author: {'steamid': '76561198163834595', 'num_games_owned': 556, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 450, 'last_played': 1708610149}
review:
Fairly typical Mahjong game. However it does seems to be fairly easy. I never seem to run out of moves. Then again, maybe I've been lucky. 

Graphics are nothing special but since it's a simplistic game, it doesn't need to be. 
Audio is also average but again, no story line or special effects so audio doesn't need to be high end either. 

This is a nice little time killer for Mahjong players. 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198050384203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 887, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1712449836}
review:
Классический маджонг в обрамлении из приятной музыки, симпатичной графики и какого-никакого сюжета. Это неожиданно, маджонг с сюжетом мне попадается впервые. Иногда сиё действо разбавляется мелкими несложными головоломками при открытии сундуков, но их не особо много.
Донат есть, но он необязательный, только для тех, кому совсем невтерпеж продвинуться по карте и сижету, игра спокойно проходится и без него. 
Приятная бесплатная вещица чтобы скоротать время не напрягая мозг и нервы.
Отдельно отмечу, что у этого издателя есть еще игра Lost Lands: A Hidden Object Adventure - ровно тот же самый сюжет с теми же декорациями, но мини-игры не маджонг, а поиск скрытых предметов. По моим ощущениям проходится быстрее, но они обе хорошие.

author: {'steamid': '76561198235297220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1913, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 65, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1712190350}
review:
Pontos positivos: Temática legal, jogo bem feito
Pontos negativos: Extremamente pay to win, vc precisa passar a faze 164894648 vezes. A energia acaba muito rápido e demora demais pra voltar. Pra vc comprar os itens é tudo em diamante que demora dropar.
Se vc quer algo só pra jogar um pouquinho e passar o tempo (como uma pessoa normal) eu recomendo sim, mas se vc é (ansioso, doente assim como eu) perfeccionista e quer zerar pode ter uma pequena possibilidade de que vc se fique estressado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198409462706', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 454, 'playtime_at_review': 1648, 'last_played': 1712411283}
review: More than Mahjong, also a puzzle game with in game purchases (not necessary but it helps out the developer)

author: {'steamid': '76561198018884873', 'num_games_owned': 2426, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1708958311}
review:
It's what you'd expect of a Mahjong game, but with a little twist. The exploration part, where you collect and combine items to unlock new regions and quests brings a little spice to the core game which I really like. The action point generation (you need to spend points for certain actions and playing levels in general) is quite fast by default and can be boosted with certain items.

All in all, you get some nice and rich content without paying anything. I'll see how far you can get for free :D

author: {'steamid': '76561199492009208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 16412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 765, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1712342956}
review: Чудова гра, щоб відволіктись і просто провести час. Єдиний мінус - кількість енергії для ходів, яка відновлюється тільки через певний час. Але для мене, як фаната маджонгу, ця гра дуже гарна. Навіть сюжет є.

author: {'steamid': '76561199267170392', 'num_games_owned': 26, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 12817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3029, 'playtime_at_review': 1645, 'last_played': 1712456826}
review: So, after many hours, and yep, I did spend some money....I've decided to change my review to "it's a good game. Grindy, but good. I still would prefer to pay for the game outright, but it is what it is and hopefully the Devs will change that. If they did, it would be awesome. I have to say, the graphics are stunning. The fairy is gorgeous, the male elf (well, he's kinda a cross between the Witcher and Legolas), the dwarf is definitely no Peter Dinklage, lol. Anyway, it's a good game to fill in time between other games".

author: {'steamid': '76561198999191293', 'num_games_owned': 91, 'num_reviews': 604, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1702323576}
review:
The start feels like if youtube clickbait thumbnails was a game. 
Like why are there so many arrows and circles?

Overall its an alright game, but so things here and there drag it down. 
The overall look feels very cramped
The store and recharge just isnt for me 
Almost a copy of one of there other games (LOST LANDS: A HIDDEN OBJECT ADVENTURE)

If your looking for a pure mohjong game this isnt for you
if your looking for a mohjong game with mini games as breaks inbetween, then this is for you

author: {'steamid': '76561198068174012', 'num_games_owned': 690, 'num_reviews': 385, 'playtime_forever': 886, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 886, 'last_played': 1696100474}
review:
Lost Lands: Mahjong (2016)

Pretty solid game of Mahjong, the energy system is slightly annoying making the game feel like a mobile game (in all fairness it was probably ported from one, i'm too lazy to bother to look it up). It's not a bad game, it's enjoyable. You can unlock new areas with coins and items you earn in game. All in all, not a bad game but your time is probably better off elswhere unless you can stomach the energy system every few hours.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198004120981', 'num_games_owned': 9076, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 6502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6502, 'last_played': 1684452887}
review:
[h1]Summary[/h1]
Easy pick up & play Mahjong game with a simple story, quests, and minigames though the same game to an older release with a different gameplay mechanic

[b]Pros[/b]
+ Easy pick up & play

[b]Cons[/b]
- Same old game just different gameplay
- Energy system

[h1]Overview[/h1]
Lost Lands: Mahjong is a good casual, easy to pick up and play Mahjong puzzle game perfect to fill your extra time and can be quite fun, if there sort of games are your thing. The game does have a story but it isn't highly impactful other than as roadblocks to the progression, though the biggest hurdle you'll find to this game is really the energy you spend each time you enter a mahjong puzzle or open chests. Getting to the end of the game will take a while if you don't spend any extra money on energy but it is possible, just play a little bit everyday.
It also has to be noted that I can't really call this a new entry in the Lost Lands series as this is just the same game given a different gameplay mechanic to it's original release.

https://store.steampowered.com/app/392950/Lost_Lands_A_Hidden_Object_Adventure/

author: {'steamid': '76561197972439760', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 409, 'last_played': 1706081545}
review:
Good Mahjong game overall. I'd give it a 6 or 7 out of 10. Good graphics, doesn't crash, merit based level increase - all good!
The downside, to me, is the need to spend money to keep playing. There should be a better way make the money. I'm not a big fan of games that say I don't have enough 'X' to play and have to buy more to continue, with no option besides cash - I just close the app and move on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097960447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1690905465}
review:
Ein sehr schönes Game, welches allerdings für Boni bezahlt werden muss, wenn man nicht warten möchte, bis die Boni aufgeladen werden. Das Spielekonzept ist gut durchdacht. Man kann Truhen öffnen, welche man im Sinne von Minispielen spielt,Durch diese erhält man Münzen oder auch andere Kleinigkeiten, die dann das Weiterspielen in anderen Ortschaften ermöglichen.
Alles im allen ein schönes Spiel was ich weiterempfehlen würde,

author: {'steamid': '76561199177131452', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 76925, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 6765, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1712429002}
review: Mahjongg games as quests are the route through an adventure game. Other puzzles are used to open chests. I like it so far... except mahjong/power/time ratio strikes me as harsh (10 minutes = 3 "power" and 1 mahjong game use 50 power - one [5 minute] game = 3 hours [wait time] - painful!).  Of course, there are occasional "power-up" / "speed-up" tokens in game and you can spend $$$ to buy them. Finally, "shuffle" is USELESS - it does NOT provide a solvable board - not once in 6 tries (e.g.: 8 tiles shuffled to 3 moves + 2 stack of same tile - USELESS!).

author: {'steamid': '76561198151060112', 'num_games_owned': 553, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 2679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 404, 'last_played': 1709106530}
review:
I saw several reviews saying that it's impossible to progress in this game without spending money, so I'm just here to let everyone know that is false. I'm sure it would /help/ some people, but it's easy to play the game without spending a dime. I haven't and won't spend any money on this. You can get a couple of games in and then you run out of energy, but it's as simple as switching games for a couple hours, or whatever you do, and then coming back. The higher level you become, the more energy you have, and the more games you can play in a single sitting. 
It's just not a game for people who want instant gratification, but it is the best mahjong game on Steam

author: {'steamid': '76561198084600718', 'num_games_owned': 773, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1684572317}
review: "Lost Lands: Mahjong" is one of those games which mixes casual game genres like match 3 and hidden object with MMO like quests where you play and grind levels to gain items to turn them in for quests. It has microtransactions and energy system, but they don't give you that much. They mostly speed up the progress and help you with mahjong sections, but mahjong sections are not that hard and the whole progression is reasonably paced. Don't rush it, play it from time to time to spend energy and you will be OK. It also seems that the studio reused assets from their other games for this one, since they have whole "Lost Lands" series of hidden object games, and then they have this version with mahjong for online play and one with hidden objects as well. But that doesn't affect you as a player, it's just something I noticed. It's also worth mentioning that this game is not (as far as I am aware) getting new content, but there is enough to satisfy your itch for casual gaming. All in all, I do recommend this game, just have in mind what you are getting yourself into and that you will not be able to play as long as you want in one sitting without paying money for energy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102238008', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 6057, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6057, 'last_played': 1592403447}
review: Простенькая игра, которая может увлечь не на один десяток часов) Обычно в играх подобного рода сюжета нет, либо он второстепенен. Здесь же наоборот: мне интереснее было следить за взаимоотношениями персонажей, чем собирать маджонги)) Есть и минусы, например игра заставляет нас собирать какие-то предметы, но их выпадание имеет вероятность, что в итоге может занять много времени. По этой же причине нас приходится играть на одних и тех же уровнях, то есть разбирать одну и туже фигуру несколько раз. Я бы дал 8 хромых драконов из 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198179339161', 'num_games_owned': 82, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 9553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1691317777}
review:
Ehrgeizige bitte nicht weiterlesen.
Für Gelegenheitsspieler ist dieses Spiel wirklich nett.
Das Setting ist mal was Neues und man kann sich gut einmal am Tag damit 30 Minuten oder so beschäftigen. Mehr ist es aber auch nicht. Wer was erreichen und echt was aufbauen will, hält sich lieber an Spiele, welches diese Genre wirklich bedienen. (Anno, usw.) Damit kann (und will?) Lost Lands: Mahjong nicht mithalten. Dafür ist es, bei allem Wohlwollen, auch viel zu simpel.
Absolut bescheiden ist das Belohnungssystem. Man bekommt Truhen, die man nur mit zugehörigen Rätseln auf Zeit öffnen kann. Ich HASSE Rätsel und lass sie einfach zu. Wie blöd ist das? He, ich schenke dir eine Truhe, aber du musst erst echt schwere Rätsel lösen? Ach, und übrigens, dabei gehen dir auch jede Menge Ressourcen verloren. Wem ist der Quatsch eingefallen?

review:

review: I love this game, I'm totally addicted to it and it works perfectly on Steam Deck. It is very relaxing to play this game and I am very eager to complete all the achievements. It is just really annoying that there is a limit on how many times you can play a day - or in an hour. I always have to wait to move on. I will not pay extra for it to complete more quickly. If you have no issue with being patient, this is a wonderful game for you!

review: Это копия Lost Lands: A Hidden Object Adventure (вышла на год раньше), но с маджонгом в виде основного занятия вместо поиска предметов... Бесплатная донатная игрушка (цены кстати диковатенькие как по мне) про поиск предметов с минииграми и коллекционированием, а также неким менеджментом карты на главной карте, откуда можно брать задания в том числе. Сделана приятненько, хоть и не блещет разрешением экрана, но ради денюжек...

Die Geschichte ist "leider" schön und der Wille weiter zu kommen, wird durch den Energieverbrauch bei jeder Runde, gebremst. Wer also Geduld hat, wird hier mit einem sehr, sehr schönen Spiel belohnt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198309978842', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 726, 'last_played': 1673361837}
review:
I've been playing this game on and off for a year or so. It's a freemium, with in-game shop, but I haven't wasted real money at all, unlike some other people who have.


Slightly longer review..


[h1]PROS:[/h1]

- Pleasant visuals, good music and acceptable effects. Nothing to complain here.

- Simple Mahjong, nothing fancy going on. I was looking for a simple game, found this freeware and I'm happy. 



[h1]CONS:[/h1]

[b]- Broken save game system. Cloud saving doesn't work. People on forums have complained about progress being reset, it's most likely because of them relying on cloud saves. If you plan to format the PC, I recommend backing up local saves. Game was last updated in 2017, so don't expect fixes.

[b]- It does have a mana limit on how much you can play every day/hours before you spend potions to recharge mana, but that has worked fine for me, so I'm not sure it's a con for me, but could be for others. I feel like if I played this too much, I would be burned out by it.

[b]- In-game shop is broken. I haven't spent a single rupee on this game, so if you DO plan to waste money, be warned, some have reported the shop not working. 



==

Overall, a fun game that is surprisingly free and not broken (gameplay-wise). There aren't many Mahjong games in the market, so this gets the job done for me.

Subscribe to my curator below for more recommendations..



[h1]=============================[/h1]


[h1][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/37751144/]SCRAPPY JUNKYARD - Curator Group[/url][/h1]


[h1]=============================[/h1]

review:
Love this game,  lots of quests to accomplish, love the graphics and story.
With that said, when I first started playing this, it was easy and fun, even as the puzzles grew in size and difficulty, until I reached a new level I was unaware of, so now it's virtually impossible to solve the puzzles. So, the fun has ended, sadly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198174700571', 'num_games_owned': 104, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1671652013}
review:
typical mahjong with a questline i can't be bothered to follow. clearly built in the generic mobile game mold with the energy system and microtransaction boosts/currencies. nothing spectacular, but i was looking for mahjong and got exactly that.

my main complaint is about the chests, and the fact that opening them requires both energy and a not-at-all fun puzzle unrelated to mahjong - which you can fail and thus waste that energy. you came here to play mahjong, you're better off grinding the levels and ignoring the chests.

if you like mahjong and easy achievements, this game is free so you're not going to lose anything if you play it.

edit: oh, i forgot. i wrote this review because of a quest they add into the queue, and i wanted to get rid of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076762964', 'num_games_owned': 605, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 2707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2349, 'last_played': 1668316574}
review:
It's a facebook/zynga style "freemium" game with that same old rechargeable energy bar and wait times, using mahjong as its main mechanic.

If you like mahjong, can commit to daily logins, tolerate the grind for resources and are ok with short burst sessions (your energy goes by very quickly. It's like the game doesn't want you to play it), then sure, go ahead. It's casual, it's flashy, and it can be played for free, although I'm not yet sure you can achive 100% in it.

Good thing the in-game store seems to be broken, as I read in the forums, because Five-BN Games probably doesn't deserve the player's money when they impose this style of monetization anyway.

[u]By the way the shuffler is a scam.[/u] When you run out of moves, you can use an item to shuffle the remaining tiles, but that creates impossible configurations over and over again, forcing you to keep spending shufflers to complete a single puzzle. Be warned. 

I still play it, just cannot recommend it due to these caveats.

review: This game is tons of fun - there's plenty of levels and locations to unlock, plus the mahjong tiles are stunning! I like the suspenseful music, and the art is beautiful. There's also a cool fantasy story about elves in the game, for anyone who's into that sort of thing. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198333861006', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 36089, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1667355617}
review:
Another Free to play game that is either a Pay to play to do any kind of decent progression in a reasonable time (energy is needed for everything and takes real time to restore... slowly) or is extremely casual (as in you play a couple of game and move on to something else entirely as you need to wait a while for energy to restore).

I also don't care that practically every time of game (not just the Mahjong games) are time.  It already cost energy to do anything, why then make it time where I can lose a mini-game (chest) and not receive anything from it?!?

author: {'steamid': '76561198052411758', 'num_games_owned': 155, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3068, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1710350701}

author: {'steamid': '76561198104365530', 'num_games_owned': 3377, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 14329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14329, 'last_played': 1662307533}
review:
Well, I have played a lot of this game, and got really dissapointed of the end, which is basically 'More coming soon!', but the game has not been updated since 2017.
Seriously, the game have a looong story with lots of quests, and at the end instead of closure you get 'well, this is as far as we got, sorry!'.
Apart from that, the game itself is competent Mahjong, if you want to try it, I would recommend to play it until you get to level 20, since that's the spot where everything came to a slog of advance, and the repetition of the same mahjong tiles over and over to find three wood planks, for a colection of 20 wood planks, or to get 40 xp, is all you will be doing level 21 and forwards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030334819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 245, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1657156193}
review:
A mobile game version of Mahjong, with energy and paid time savers. 

There's no borderless fullscreen and no mouse sensitivity options. 
But there are plenty of options to give them microtransaction money! 

- You start a level and realise, wow, these patterns really aren't balanced at all - throws you in on a hard pattern right after the tutorial. 
- To earn 3 stars you have to complete the level within a time, but it's impossible without paid time savers (you get a few for free so you can see how useful they are before they fuck you over). You'll need at least two per level as well to get max stars. This is the same for hints and tile shuffles. Also, your mouse sensitivity is locked and it's kinda slow, making things take even longer. 
- There are quests and things to unlock more levels, but there's a chance you simply cannot complete a game. And therefore, you get absolutely nothing in return and don't progress after however long you played. 
- That means you slog through long levels, for little to no reward and then you eventually run out of energy and can't play the game. What a miserable experience. 
- Sound effects and visuals aren't good quality either. 

This is just what I noticed in less than 30 mins of gameplay. 
Do yourself a favour and download Microsoft Mahjong on the program store. 
Unlike Microsoft Solitaire, it's premium mode is not on Gamepass, but it is still free and doesn't spend more time on payment options than it does making the actual game a positive experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198345639026', 'num_games_owned': 37, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 5210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1657739002}
review:
Mahjong with a little bit of a story 
so far the difficulty is nice the story and collecting items keeps you from getting bored too quickly. The music is super relaxing and the controls are super easy. Their are micro-transaction but all it does is add energy or coins which you could play the whole game without a cent if you choose so. My only complaint is that I wish that I could choose differnt themes for the tiles instead of just the one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977383580', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1683185741}
review:
It's Mahjong, and It's free!  Sure, they've thrown in some of the same gimmicks that nearly EVERY mobile game does nowadays, in addition to time-gating play.  But, if you enjoy the puzzles themselves, you only run into the time block occasionally **And if you're like me, that just means it's time to get back to being a productive member of society**. 

You've got the option to throw some money to the game, to increase playtime and speed through 'progression', but it doesn't seem to be necessary in the least.

Great for anyone who's looking to do a few puzzles here and there, and kill some time.

author: {'steamid': '76561199054616121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1644638901}
review: I didn't realize this would be a wait for more energy type of game, which I loath with a passion. The colors, though I do understand they're the typical colors used in Mahjong, hurt my eyes after a bit. Some tiles don't match, but are a "pair", so that was confusing. The artwork is beautiful and the music is nice, but that's about the only nice things I can say about this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081281137', 'num_games_owned': 539, 'num_reviews': 238, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1644455872}
review: The gameplay itself is fine if you like playing mahjong, but it has all the generic mobile game constraints, waiting for energy to play, powerups to win, confusing menus with 100000 things to click, claim, spin blah blah blah . Would be okay as a mobile game, needs to be better for pc imo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998184466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1652, 'last_played': 1644060734}
review: too many required unlocking items to advance bases most tiles repeated same tile placements, kinda dirty that need ti use up reshuffle tools. not worth playing, seeking other better Mahjong format. glad i didnt use real cash for this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273470009', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 24455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2528, 'last_played': 1696160347}
review: Good combination of mahjong and other puzzles, which as you solve, you gather coins and other resources to complete quests and repair buildings. I love the mechanics and everything. Every game you play uses energy though and by the time you get to level 6, you run out of energy points and you have to either wait for hours or use actual money to buy energisers to restore it. Very annoying but if you have no self-control like me and could play all day, it's a good thing because it forces you to stop after a few games - if you'd rather not spend tons of money on it that is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060933303', 'num_games_owned': 375, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 4083, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1654784336}

author: {'steamid': '76561198142946549', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 6202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1645703680}
review: Obvious roots in mobile gaming, but it's got enough quests and the speed of energy is quick enough to not push a whole lot of paying.  It does ramp up the needed energy fairly quickly.  It's fairly easy to tell most of the tiles apart, it could do with an option to switch to bigger tiles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072018869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 5191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1672213377}
review: It's actually pretty good for being free. There's a lot more story than I expected, and that spices it up a little. A lot of microtransaction possibilities, and of course the standard thing where you run out of chances and either have to wait or spend money to play again immediately. You definitely CAN play for free. The things I don't like about it are the puzzles to open the chests, and the timer in the regular part. I don't have trouble making it in the time limit, but I was really looking for something a little more chill when I downloaded this game. I would pay probably like $15 if I could turn the timer off and remove the microtransactions. Overall a good game, but with the microtransaction problems that many free games have.

review:
Très bon jeu pour se détendre et passer le temps. 
Jeu de mahjong type "trouver les paires" facile à prendre en main avec une difficulté bien calibré. L'histoire est sympathique et bien menée.

Je recommande ce jeu.
P.S: je conseil de ne pas dépenser vos "cristaux" (monnaie du jeu qui s'obtient avec du vrai argent) car ceux obtenu de part le jeu devrait tout juste vous permettre de débloquer certains niveaux et ainsi continuer ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561199180268625', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1637661698}
review: I'm still very new to this game having just downloaded it today but, I've got to say, I'm really enjoying it. So far it is quite challenging for me; far more than the other Lost Lands games I've played. Furthermore, I've never played Mahjong whatsoever, so the art I'm seeing is all brand new. But, I'm slowly getting the hang of it. Consistently getting 1 or 2 stars  now, though I started off just thrilled when I completed a puzzle before time was up. Anyway, looking forward to getting better and better at it. If you like HO games with a touch of "memory" thrown in, this will be right up your ally too.

If you like puzzles, Solitaire, and Mahjong, This is worth looking at.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091089067', 'num_games_owned': 440, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 1420, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1073, 'last_played': 1631331975}
review:
[h1]Lost Lands: Mahjong - типичный фры ту плэй[/h1]
[i]Ну задонать, ну умоляю...[/i]

Lost Lands: Mahjong - казалось бы, можно ли вообще испортить незамысловатую игру с очень простым, древним и релаксирующим жанром - маджонг? У разработчиков FIVE-BN GAMES это получилось. Начнём с самого начала. Перед вами экран, бегают какие-то кабаны и орки, висит парочку открытых локаций и куча закрытых. В левой части экрана возникает новоиспеченный квест. Обычно этот квест вообще никоим образом не связан с сюжетом, так как он сделан в стиле: помоги убить мне 5 кабанов, я не могу выйти из дома, принеси мне 10 досок, я не в состоянии их найти, собери мне какую-то хрень, потому что не твоё дело почему. И я бы хотел сказать, что вы встретите разнообразие за 20 часов игры, но нет. Квесты сходи на локацию *вставить сюда название локации* 5 раз, убей 5 *вставить сюда название монстра*, принеси/собери *количество* *вставить сюда название предмета* - это единственное, чем игра способна вас порадовать. Да, есть ещё различные головоломки в сундуках, которые выпадают из врагов, но они однотипные и их вариаций не так уж и много, поэтому в конечном счёте они начнут повторяться. А теперь самое интересное - на каждое ваше действие тратится энергия. И хотелось бы сказать, что можно скрафтить себе пирожок и гулять ещё пару часов, но нет. Энергия сжирается буквально за пару игр в маджонг, всё остальное время вы можете сидеть и "курить бамбук" (ну или по задумке разработчиков просто-напросто не играть в игру весь оставшийся день). И это замечательное введение энергии в игру сильно намекает нам про донат. А доната здесь будь здоров. Во-первых, можно покупать часть предметов, которые пришлось бы добывать несколькими играми в маджонг. Во-вторых, бустеры под видом амулетов повышают опыт, увеличивают шансы сундуков, увеличивают добычу золота и делают много чего ещё, учитывая, что амулетов в игре около десятка. В третьих, донат даёт нам уникальные предметы для маджонга или головоломок в сундуках. Например, можно купить ключ, который автоматически выполнит за вас головоломку. А в маджонге, если зайти в тупик (проще говоря, к поражению), можно перемешать поле и в итоге продолжить играть, этакий второй шанс за донат. Каждый уровень, который вы получите в этой игре будет сопровождаться назойливым окном со скидкой на донат предложение, мол только сегодня и только сейчас за какие-то жалкие *вставить сюда сумму деняк* вы получите *вставить сюда абсолютно бесполезные предметы*. Враги на карте не имеют вообще никакого смысла. Они бесконечно спавнятся и просто пылесосят карту без приченения вреда кому-либо и чему-либо. Раз в пару квестов появляется какой-то квестовый персонаж, который просит убить новый вид врагов. Теперь вместо двух пылесосов по вашей карте будет ездить три пылесоса. Невероятно. Кстати, о монетах (золоте), то есть игровой бесплатной валюте. Её получаемое количество почему-то сильно уменьшено. Она тратится очень быстро и восполняется очень медленно, что по итогу приводит к тем самым амулетам (донат бустеры). Ещё интереснее становится, когда открываешь локации постарше, то есть к уровням этак 18-21. Для исследования локации нужен пропуск. Локацию я тебе дам, ПРОПУСК Я ТЕБЕ НЕ ДАМ. То есть очередной цыганский раз: позолоти ручку пожалусто, разработчеки голодные. И казалось бы, ну куда уже более нагло??? А потом, чтобы на этой локации проходить маджонги нужно за каждый маджонг отдавать ещё по одному мини-пропуску, например, для подводного города нужен предмет, чтобы дышать под водой, без этого нельзя сыграть маджонг. Проще говоря, если собираетесь играть, то качайте сразу CheatEngine или ArtMoney. В противном случае наткнетесь на тупик и всё упрётся в наглый донат. Это маркетинговая уловка и разводняк, а не игра. Определённо игру не рекомендую даже для любителей маджонга. Лучше запустите бесплатный маджонг в винде или загуглите онлайн маджонг, чем играть в это.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985133181', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 574, 'last_played': 1631007237}
review:
Game places obstacles between you and playing the game, and is pretty obnoxious about it. Also turns muted volume back on when it launches. 

Unless you enjoy having someone else decide when you're allowed to play mahjong solitaire, skip this and play a better game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262918011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1636944268}
review: I love to play Mahjong, but I very much dislike games that use 'energy' which you swiftly run out of, thereby stopping your progress. Don't get me wrong, the game itself is great (which is why I keep going back to it), but I really cannot recommend a game that you have to stop playing after a few minutes. Unless of course, you are one of those people who don't mind paying real money for virtual stuff within a game. If that's the case, then go ahead and buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561199101661386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1654880052}
review: It's a pretty good game, pretty straightfoward, not bad for a free mahjong game

author: {'steamid': '76561199112491812', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4121, 'last_played': 1687119119}
review:
Ein tolles Spiel für Zwischendurch :)
Neben dem normalen Mahjong-Spiel und ein bisschen Story außen rum, gibt es auch noch eine Vielzahl anderer Rätsel, die man in Truhen bekommt. Die finde ich ziemlich toll :3
Den Punkt, dass man Geld für dieses Spiel ausgeben müsste, damit man ordentlich voran kommt, sehe ich nicht. Man kann Tränke und ähnliche Items sammeln, die einem noch mehr Energie zum Verbrauchen geben, wenn man wirklich mal einen langen Mahjong-Abend machen will. Ich hatte noch nie das Gefühl, irgendwo zu viel eingeengt zu sein und hab mir einfach alle Möglichkeiten, Zusatzmaterial automatisch zu erhalten, freigearbeitet und hole das jetzt regelmäßig ab.
Für mich ist das ein durch und durch gut gemachtes kostenloses Spiel^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198028912848', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1659183351}
review: Jeu de Mahjong intéressant pour passer le temps. La bande sonore est agréable et variée, le jeu est esthétique, on n'en demande pas beaucoup plus pour ce type de jeu. Quelque peu répétitif mais la trame de l'histoire et les quelques petites missions maintiennent notre intérêt à avancer dans le jeu. Le point négatif inhérent à tout jeu gratuit est la barre d'énergie qui limite toute progression rapide dans le jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198821397133', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1626627295}
review:
This game is like crack...don't do it. Maybe for your mom or something, but not for yourself. Play Heroes or something else. It's like mahjong, but for gamers...you level up and need loot to fight creatures that appear on the map that give you loot so that you can play another level to get some loot for a quest for a sexy elf girl that gives you loot. And you cant't just keep playing because our energy bar goes down and you have to purchase a fucken drink to refill that or fucken wait a couple of minutes for it to refill +1, when the whole bar is 90 points and you need 20 to play a level.
Just don't do it.
But good game!

author: {'steamid': '76561199115251515', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1339, 'last_played': 1630272151}
review:
This is a nice majhong solitaire game. I love it as a quiet wind-down before bed, or during my breaks from work. Each round is quick, with pretty backgrounds and background music to relax you as you play.
Sure, it has micro transactions. What game doesn't these days? But you can get pretty far without them, if you're willing to take the time to keep re-playing a level until you succeed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198174175327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1622602859}
review: Nicely designed. Mahjong fun is fun,.. Good for a few hours play, to sweeten you up. BUT, this game is a complete Rip-off!. Soon you'll discover ur running out of energy to carry on playing, and thats the point where the Micro-economy shop kicks in. Causcious estimate calculates that you probably have to spend a few Hundred(!) euro's to unlock all area's. LOL, youre better of getting a (few) years sub of a proper Mmorpg. Shame on you!.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027782034', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 6529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1699286152}
review:
Lost Lands: Mahjong is an excellent example of a above-average casual game that is just completely destroyed by greed. All of the worst qualities of casual gaming are here... there is an energy meter that limits how many levels you can play per day, there are micro transactions for literally everything. This game is downright predatory in how it tries to leverage the game play to force you into paying to play. 

See, the boards in Lost Lands are not randomly generated. They have the same tiles in the same place every time, and each board has a sort of flow to it. Generally speaking, you need to be deliberate in how you choose which tiles to match. It's usually bad to pick two tiles that are too close together, because you may need a particular tile to make inroads elsewhere on the board. This means that on any given board, it is possible to create an unsolvable state. And unlike most games in the genre, if you run out of legal moves, that's it. There is a reshuffle, but it's going to cost you an item to use. It's also worth mentioning that if you wait until you are out of legal moves to reshuffle, the reshuffle is probably going to be wasted. Since you have a finite amount of energy to play boards, the inclination is to try and salvage any loss so you can continue to level up and unlock more levels. It is shameless.

The energy takes an absurd amount of time to recharge. Unlike other games by FIVE-BN, the fastest time to recharge a single point of energy is 2:50. That number also takes work to achieve. I believe the game starts off at 3:30 per unit and then you have to complete some quests using absurd amounts of construction items, which of course the game is happy to sell you for real money. There are also amulets which halve the recharge time, but they are exceedingly rare and, coincidentally, available for purchase. Compare that to some of the FIVE-BN hidden object games where each level requires similar amounts of energy to play, but the default recharge time is 1 minute per energy.

Pacing is also a major issue. The game drags itself out behind quests that require you to play the same boards over and over again for days at a time, and all of the sudden the experience requirement goes from something like 2,000 xp to go from level 19 to 20, to 20,000 xp to go from level 20 to 21. That is an agonizing number of timed quests and boards to have to clear when the most experience you can get from a single board is 90, and you can only play that board roughly 4-6 times per day depending on how much effort you put in to increasing your energy maximum and how often you're willing to show up for the complimentary +10 energy you can cash in every hour. Of course there are amulets that will increase the amount of xp you can get from quests and boards... for a price. 

The consensus in the community pages is that Lost Lands: Mahjong will take you about 90 hours to complete, a ridiculous amount of time for a game with fewer than 150 unique boards to play. FIVE-BN could have charged a flat $5 for a 10-15 hour experience and it would have made a stellar game, but when greed comes to casual gaming, everybody loses. This is the free-est game that I promise you can't afford to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561199150861539', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 10244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1689466476}

I can see losing a life if you fail to complete a scene but it costing 15 energy per each really cuts down on the play time and I am assuming they will cost more as I move along. But anywho, so far so good!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1618660035}
review:
Lost Lands: Mahjong is a mobile app that's been dumped on PC in a greedy cash grab from mobile devs.  This is a simple mahjong tile matching game, tap on your phone screen to match 2 of the same tiles and remove them from the puzzle, and repeat until all the tiles are gone. 

As far as PC games go, this really isn't one.  There's no video or control customisability and the graphics are very low res, to cater to the mobile phones it was designed for.

This game isn't really free, it's a time + money gated microtransaction hell.  Every game you play reduces your "energy" until you can't play any more puzzles, then you have to wait hours, or pay exorbitant mobile phone microtransaction fees to keep playing.  

You can play mahjong for free in a browser, and given this is typical, predatory priced mobile app store garbage, I can't recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050139573', 'num_games_owned': 488, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2197, 'last_played': 1622870610}
review:
Плюсы: симпатичная графика, классическая головоломка, бесплатна.
А вот дальше буду ругаться ибо: нельзя отключить в меню заставку, игра - копия другой с поиском предметов, из-за особенностей головоломки можно проиграть вне зависимости от ваших умений, донат.
И да, я бы не ругался, но, когда проигрываешь в 5 раз и перемешивание не помогает, это плохо.
 Не рекомендую.

review: Короче ребят это игра на ваше усмотрение, т.к она все-таки бесплатна. Здесь накрутки процентных шансов на получение чего либо, если вам что-то нужно выбить - то именно это вы и не будете получать в 80% случаев имхо. Плюс у меня сложилось впечатление, что происходит подлог перевернутых костей, которых вы не видите - частые победы вам будут делать хуже, одни поражения - помогут чуть-чуть, но это ощущения я особо не проверял этот момент.

review:
Дуже приємно грати в Маджонг з продуманим фентезійним сюжетом. 
Я взагалі обожнюю Маджонг як такий, але для мене стала приємною несподіванкою сама можливість будувати міста в грі, виконувати квести та збирати колекції. 
Дійсно новий рівень настолки. Я задоволена. ♥

author: {'steamid': '76561198969316285', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 8083, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1634617393}
review: Siempre fui una fanática de los juegos de Mahjong en línea. Quise buscar una alternativa ya que muchos de mis favoritos se habían eliminado debido a la nueva política de Flash Player, y afortunadamente encontré este. Al inicio fue un poco complicado pero pronto le encontré la maña, como diríamos, y han sido horas de solucionar juegos de Mahjong de manera entretenida y desafiante. Perfecto para pasar el tiempo tranquilamente y sin presiones.

author: {'steamid': '76561198393544273', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3978, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1712104056}

review:
classic mahjong. interesting art. the rpg elements could use some more balance. It creates a setting, but does not really add much to the gameplay, no enticement to follow the story or build up characters. Energy runs out pretty quickly too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110707304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1079, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1668545053}
review:
Напоминает о мобильных играх, где тебе постоянно приходится ждать, когда откулдаунятся жизни или энергия.
А в целом вполне приемлемо. И, несмотря на то, что я терпеть не могу игры, где тебя поджимают ограничения по времени, здесь даже  у меня просыпается некоторый азарт. 
Что еще. Нравятся головоломки из сундуков.
Немножко забавляет ультракрасочность всего антуража. И больше всего забавляет прорисовка неписей, которые дают задания. Особенно их выражения лиц. Особенно у Рыбака. Я себе уже всё лицо отбила фейспалмами XD
И еще нравится то, что игра, судя по коллешкам, достаточно длинная.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028711579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 284, 'playtime_forever': 5468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2558, 'last_played': 1618604795}
review:
Your typical "pay to progress faster"-type of game. Specifically designed to trigger your want to pay real money for ingame items that speed up processes. You have a stamina bar & limited starting resources with which to access certain areas or whatnot. Everything costs alot for very little, and some items are rarer than others to come across and are very expensive to buy. But it's just enough to entice you it might be worth buying that ONE energy crystal, or that ONE key to a chest, or that LAST piece of of armor that never seem to wanna drop during natural game progression.

In other words, if you have even the slightest tendency or history of a gambling issue, stay clear, or this free game might end up costing you quite a great deal.

If you can hold off from resorting to to buying ingame items with your real money, or just spend what you think the game is worth in the first place, then it's a nice relaxing (though timed) mahjong game (with lovely ambient sounds) with some optional puzzles scattered in there.
It is worth noting that it is exactly the same in regards of story etc as Lost Lands: Hidden Object Adventure, so if you're choosing between the two just go for whatever category you fancy the most. I enjoy it but but I think the practice of "pay-to-progress-faster" is sneaky, so therefor a negative review for the sake of others.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048638234', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 5068, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4180, 'last_played': 1611375876}
review: I enjoyed this game. If you like occasional rounds of Majong, this game was pretty decent. There are also minigames puzzles that I liked all of except for block puzzles which I always have difficulty solving.  If you are looking for constantly playing Majong, this probably isn't the best as you only get a few rounds before you have to wait, but if you just have time here and there, I think this a really fun.  One other thing is that you do have to redo old Majong rounds.  I didn't mind but if you are against redoing old puzzles this might not be good either.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078923958', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1606082144}
review:
Нда, знал я в прошлом бесплатный маджонг(не выньдовский а пиратский  123 мегабайта весом)), ну а тут обычная фтпшка.
Как обычно, какое то зло напало на фентезяшную страну, эльфы, которые должны бы были разбудить спящего красавца, стража, за каким то хером уплыли куда подальше с его гробом. Часть благополучно утопла, ибо дебилы. Ну а проснувшийся в итоге страж, какой то беспомощный он правда, начинает страдать фигней, и разгонять кобольдов и свинок, тратя на каждого по одному мечу или копью..... Ну и маджонг разбирать.
Игра сразу же выдает нам тупое фтпшное обучение, сразу же вручает ежедневную награду, и не выдает табельную эльфийку, только какого то старпера. Уникальных квестов тоже не завезли, прогони кобольда, почини лодку(прогони хз сколько кобольдов, пока материалы дропнутся)) и прочие детские болезни обычных фтпшек. Ну или донать и проходи квесты парой кликов.

Единственный нормальный элемент, собсно маджонг, да и в нем есть свои приколы, некоторые фишки нарисованы по разному, но чистят друг друга. 

Не рекомендую, лучше купить какой нить маджонг, благо цены на них обычно невысоки, и спокойно расслабляться.

review: Didn't care for this one. It has lore which is nice, but overall I found it reminiscent of a mobile game. It has a cash shop and stamina, and paid currency. What I really disliked was that there is a timer on each level. I didn't realize we were supposed to match sets that didn't match each other and ended up timing out on the second level. I've never encountered that rule in other mahjong solitaire games I have played. Overall, really dissatisfied with this one.

review:
Good for wasting a bit of time now and then, similar to faerie solitaire in that way. Difference with this is it has "energy" like mobile games along with the microtransactions to buy more. So you won't be playing nonstop for hours but it's nice to have to open up now and then. 

I am writing this review at 0.8 hours which is how long I was able to play from install to drained of energy without using any sort of powerups.

review:
Донатная мобильная помойка с потрясающими артами. Играть не рекомендую. Если только с читами, поскольку без большого числа донатов  игра непроходима. 
Если вам понравились картинки, лучше обратите внимание на Lost Lands: A Hidden Object Adventure. Там тоже самое, только вместо маджонга поиск предметов. И там, хотя бы в теории, можно пройти игру без донатов/читов.

review: This is a fun, free game. I was just looking for a Mahjong game to play to relax, but this adds on lots of mini-games and puzzles and rewards, and a map to uncover. You can make purchases in game but I don't and it seems so far like I'm not missing anything. It maybe took a little longer to get started before I could open new parts of the map, but once I got going it's moving along nicely now. Fun, colorful, not too challenging but not completely mindless.

review:
I like this game. Play it everyday before i go to work. The fantasy theme its a nice add to the mahjong puzzle. It's a good game to play for a short run. Microtransactions and energy system doesn't bother me, because i play it casual (10 to 15 min runs). 
What really, REALLY annoys me are the sound fx. The bird sounds forced me to play it whithout volume. And the intro is way too loud! I mean, I play it while my family is sleeping, and all of the sudden it yells OUR STORY BEGINS LONG BEFORE... so i have to turn off my speaker.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032319879', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 36729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1644716088}
review:
The game itself is good. They gave an RPG fantasy flaire with leveling and magic items to the standard Mahjong game so you have a reason to keep playing. Unfortunately... they murder the game with the whole "energy" concept that we frequently see in games with microtransactions. Basically it means your time to play the game is limited and you end up never getting to play the game as much as you want. The hope is that you spend money to play more time per day. It's something that should never be done. It's good for a quick buck, but players end up disliking the game because of the forced rationing. It's great for children that get "1 hour of computer per day".

There is a premium version that Microsoft offers (not on steam) that does away with the whole energy concept. It has its own issues with faulty game saves. Does not seem to be able to save a profile properly so save games are lost. If they fix this, the premium one is pretty good. 

Steam  - make the premium one available.

Thanks!

author: {'steamid': '76561197999155882', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 8509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1862, 'last_played': 1660837853}
review:
Well, the fantasy theme is nice and trough playing mahjong 
you gather items to rebuild the buildings of the island you playing on. 
Very nice music holds up the mood while puzzeling.
For me the greatest advantage of this mahjong is only in about 15 puzzles one does not line up.

I finished the game. It has no end just a message "Stay tuned update will come soon". 
The game is from 2016, so they just stopped finishing the game on its very end. Disappointing!
But it's free, so why do i care.

author: {'steamid': '76561199023079910', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5059, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4437, 'last_played': 1597597222}
review:
Ein geiles Spiel, was ich so dermaßen hasse weil  es nicht funktioniert !!!!!!
An sich ein total tolles Spiel, absolute Suchtgefahr, wenn es nicht ständig hängen würde, man kann nur an den Minispielen teilnehmen wenn genügend Energie zu Verfügung steht, das ist schon schwierig da man die für jede Aufgabe braucht und es Ewigkeiten dauert bis sie wieder zur Verfügung steht. Genau dann wenn man ein Mahjong lösen will und noch voll in der Zeit ist, keinen falschen Stein angeklickt hat und man dann raus geworfen wird mit der Begründung "Zeit abgelaufen" oder "kein Zug mehr vorhanden" man könnte dann für echtes Geld Energie oder Diamanten kaufen um an den Spiel weiter zu machen und wenn sowas 5 mal hinter einander passiert ist das mehr als ätzend !!!!!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198034096697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1098, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 887, 'last_played': 1612320797}
review: It's a fun mahjong game.  The only complaint is that you run out of energy quickly and some of the locations require objects to access them so progression is pretty slow.  If you only want to spend 15 minutes or so playing -- it's fine.  If you are looking for game play longer than that at a stretch, I'd skip this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078711461', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1595957670}
review:
基本無料の課金ゲーです。内容は他の方の言うとおり、いわゆる「上海」「麻雀ソリティア」です。
これといってルールに特徴があったりもしません。課金しなくともそこそこは遊べます。
やることはただのパズルの繰り返しですが、Hidden Object系によくあるようにストーリーがあり、
登場人物が出てきてクエストを出されて、（大抵はアイテムを探し出してくれとかそういう話）
パズルをクリアすることで目当てのアイテムが手に入りストーリーが進むというもの。

麻雀ソリティアのルールは、左右や上を他の牌で塞がれていないことを条件に、神経衰弱のように
2つの同じ柄の牌を取り除いていき、最終的に牌がなくなったらクリアというものです。
親切に取れる牌（左右や上を塞がれていない牌）がハイライトされているので選択しやすいのは○。
ただ取っていくうちにこれ以上牌が取れない、いわゆる手詰まり状況になるのですが、牌の並べ直しが
消費アイテムを使ってしかできない点は×です。正直これは難易度設定上必要なことは分かりますが、
どの牌を取っていけば手詰まりになるかなどプレイヤーには分かりようがない（下に埋まってる牌が
何の柄かは、上の牌を取るまで分からない）ので、フェアじゃないと感じてしまうからです。
まあ課金によって利益を上げる製品なのでしょうがないですが。

日本語はありません。ストーリーを読まずパズルだけやる方はまったく問題ないでしょうが、
一応何が起きてるのか知りたいという方はちょっとした量を頻繁に読むことになります。
文章自体はまあまあやさし目です。

おすすめはしますが、10点中6点ぐらいです。

author: {'steamid': '76561197997969723', 'num_games_owned': 789, 'num_reviews': 166, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1594007088}
review:
The horrendous world of mobile gaming has been vomited onto Steam in this festering pile of garbage.   Micro-transaction trash, VERY poor interface built obviously for the use of touch devices rather than mouse and keyboard, vile sound effects, lack of short-cut keys, .... and who did your 3D graphics (like the "mahjong" tiles), a 2 year old child?    Worst of all, this game has time-based energy collection where you collect energy to perform actions over real time, with of course the option to spend real money to get diamonds in game to buy more energy.  
Forget this, and be wary of the developer.

review:
It's not a bad game - sure, it's a cash grab, but it's a free game that doesn't really force you to buy anything and even if you do end up buying some ingame currency, the prices are fairly reasonable, unlike some games (looking at you, Raid: Shadow Legends!). Also, the core gameplay is fun (nothing innovative but fun nonetheless) and the campaign does help with the overall atmosphere...

A solid 6,5/10 from me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960522295', 'num_games_owned': 2188, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 2580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1606678554}
review:
Un buon passatempo, supera abbondantemente la sufficienza, un gioco da tablet portato su PC

Graficamente scarsino (anche in 4k), sonoro buono e tanti, tantissimi livelli; il gioco sembra avere una storia ma non la sto seguendo più di tanto, l'unico obiettivo sono le 3 stelle su ogni livello

Peccato che non si possa giocare illimitatamente ma ogni tanto bisogna staccare per far ricaricare l'energia, ma è già troppo per un gioco gratutito

Voto 6.5

author: {'steamid': '76561198068283182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 24, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1712275367}
review:
Considering this is a Free to Play game, the graphics are quite nice and the music, very immersive. I like how the main gameplay is still Mahjong (and so many variations of tile formations), but the quests and story line give you something to aim for as you play. And, the mini-games are quite fun as well. 

All in all, I got this game to unwind in between playing more intense games, but it ended up becoming a game I looked forward to playing on its own. And I can tell that a lot of other players have had the same experience. Download if you're looking for a relaxing game with enough of a plot and progression to keep you engaged. 

Cheers.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999166071', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1589339058}
review: Another amazing Mahjong game that you don't have to pay for up front, [u]when you actually get to play Mahjong.[/u]  But the rest of the game was confusing.  I know it's supposed to be like a merge with an RPG.  But the interface didn't really make it easy to figure out how to just start a Mahjong game, and skip the "build this, build that" stuff.  Sure it's interesting to do on the side.  But I think the developer lost focus on what the game is supposed to be primarily about.... Playing Mahjong.  There should be an easier way to just play Mahjong, and mess with the RPG stuff later.  But it takes a while clicking on everything to figure out where to actually start a game.

review: Отличная графика, приятная музыка, интересная игра. Кроме уровней с маджонгом, есть квесты (основной сюжет) и уровни с разгадыванием нескольких видов головоломок (сундуки). Много уровней с разной сложностью заданий

author: {'steamid': '76561198121668916', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 13342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2861, 'last_played': 1704203425}
review: It's free to play, but the duration is short unless to pay to proceed. If you don't mind waiting a day for your energy level to build back up then it's a very nice game sound and graphics wise to. In my opinion, it's a money grubbing process that will frustrate and anger you. But that's just me... A year later and it's worse than before. The tiles very often realign so it's impossible to complete without paying. You spend tokens on a mission all the way to level 49 and one to go to master it. Then I have to spend resources to enter mission only to say stay tuned for the update! They made a 50 puzzles mission with only 49 that you can play. 6 times or more I spent resources over several weeks and still no update. Money grubbing, lazy scoundrels.

author: {'steamid': '76561198364633661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 137, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1712108288}
review:
Modest implementation with some plusses and minuses.

Pro:
-The questing for items and unlocking areas is a nice variant.   Gives you a reason to mix it up.
-All in all, the game is solidly built.  It is what it looks like, without good music.

Cons:
-The matches themselves are very similar.  Somehow they missed the match variations that make different maps interesting.  I can't even tell you how it's not, it just is very monotonous.  I think this is tied in with the timer.  The matches are relatively easy, and the difficulty comes from the timer, rather than intellectual lock-solving.

-Given maps have pieces in the same spots.  So if you fail, you literally play the exact same game again and remember not to do the bad thing.

-The timer is stupid.  It's supposed to be a relaxing game with room for thought and foresight.  Giving it a 5 min timer just makes it a hurried clickfest.  You don't win by thinking, you win by clicking fast and occassionally randomly getting screwed, which you just repeat the next cycle without the error.  However, the 5 minutes are usually enough, because the matches are easy enough they don't actually require thought.

-The music isn't relaxing.  Traditional japanese variants of this game have much better relaxing music/rainfall or whatever.  I miss that.

-The stamina is also stupid.  Don't get any ideas of spending 2 hours playing, you get maybe 4-5 matches racing 5 min a shot and then it kicks you out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131777252', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3698, 'last_played': 1589128500}
review:
Интересный мажонг, с типа сюжетом, нарисовано неплохо.

Донат особо не портит, особенно если не упарываться, а понемногу играть, три-пять в день, для расслабления.

Но граждане изготовители, ну епрст, откуда такие  ошибки, у вас что, ворд с проверкой правописания ни у кого не стоит?  Пинками гнали продавать, некогда проверить было? Так даже стим подсказывает, как правильно.

На уровне третьего класса, какая-то девочка-стажёрка чтоль писала тексты по-русски? Предает сил талисман, вот так, через "е"?! 

Отсюда некоторый налёт второсортности, как ни крути.

А так, игру конечно рекомендую.

review:
ein Mahjong-Zeitspiel ohne zeit zum denken oder schauen, Auch wenn man rechtzeitig fertig wird, erhält man nicht das gewünschte material  sondern irgendeinen zufällige schrott (Sollte ein Buch finden das es nur dort gibt -habe es aber in 30 versuchen -davon 20 erfolgreich-  nicht einmal gesehen,
dafür aber 30 mal oder mehr die aufforderung doch mi gefälligst im shop neue  energie zu kaufen.
da empfehle ich doch lieber jedem Mahjong-Liebhaber sich im netz ein wirklich kostenloses spiel herunterzuladen und nicht diese free-to-pay version,

author: {'steamid': '76561198007324078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 22394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1616627178}
review:
An energy-based Mahjong game? Sure, why not. As a "Chinese-type" game (see edit below), it's as bad as any other; as a Mahjong game, well, it's Mahjong. It is what it says it is, no surprises here.

The framing (ie everything in the game besides the actual hidden-object levels) was recycled from Lost Lands: A Hidden Object Adventure.

Edit: LOL I originally called it an MMO :P but hey, you know what type of game I mean: there's a cliche excuse story with fetch quests and you progress very slowly by grinding, and the story is not important anyway, you just want to level up and reach certain milestones. Just like a Chinese-type MMO - but no multiplayer elements, of course.

author: {'steamid': '76561199044517287', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 9128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1593530205}

review: Me gusta la combinación de resolver rompecabezas para ir avanzando en la construcción del pueblo. Me gustaría más variedad de rompecabezas. Me gustan los gráficos. Como pasa con otro juegos de este tipo, al final el dinero no es tan útil como la energía o los diamantes. Me gustaría más premios en diamantes y energía puesto que esto es lo que realmente impulsa el juego y te posibilita avanzar, de lo contrario terminas teniendo que esperar a que se recuperen los niveles de energía.

author: {'steamid': '76561199025270923', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 50648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37163, 'last_played': 1654963560}
review:
不知不觉游戏时间都超过600小时了，没有评价游戏的习惯，但好不容易算是通关了，忍不住来写点儿啥。
1.  免费游戏，已经算是很精良了。所谓的能量条防沉迷系统，也是一种变相的赚钱方式。不充钱也可以玩儿的很开心。
2. 没有任何游戏内消费，不靠任何攻略，自己慢慢玩儿，打穿剧情需要整整2个月的时间。大概1个多月能够达成steam全成就，主线剧情1个半月的时候能够完成，最后开启传送门并打完，需要整整2个月。而且游戏内的全成就还差很多。
3. 游戏后半段的一些限时任务，有时候完不成的收益，比完成了还要高。尤其是收集某些特殊物品或收藏品的。
4. 前期建筑材料缺，后期合成材料缺。合成材料会一直缺，尤其是那些打场景里不出来，只能掉落的。
5. 月石的效果，有时候会远远超过其文字描述。最高能实现55秒涨一格能量。
6. 注意升级时能恢复能量上限的设定，妥善使用能量，毕竟很宝贵。
7. 乐器这个收藏品确实最实用，提升能量上限的物品不多。
8. 钻石不要瞎用，去买提升能量上限的药水最有用，还可以加100能量。
9. 社区里的攻略都是大神的精华，虽然宝箱的答案会让游戏失去乐趣，但前面的一些小心得还是非常值得参考。
其他的一时间也想不起来了，随着游戏发展，曾经想写很多东西，后来过了那段时间也就慢慢遗忘了。总体来说，是一个非常值得推荐的小游戏，原本是为了打发时间，而且游戏自带防沉迷系统，但没想到却更加让人沉迷……

author: {'steamid': '76561198050051452', 'num_games_owned': 670, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1585237162}
review:
Would be a lot better without the Energy/timer feature. Having to start/stop/wait is an easy way to lose people. When I run out of energy I'm going to go to another game. It could be days/weeks/months and yes even years for me to get back around to something that essentially is telling me to "go away" for a while. Trust me, I've got plenty of other games I could be playing and doesn't really have anything to keep me coming back. So far the story is broad and vague. The quests make you repeat areas many times to level up and find the items. You have to pay energy & do a puzzle to open item chests you WON in another area. 
I'm playing on PC and the game didn't even want to load up when I was in a larger resolution. I had to lower it down to get it to load, reconfigure the game settings to windowed mode, then returned my resolution to original. Perhaps this game is meant to be played more on a tablet or phone because the mouse movement also feels sluggish.
So while I do enjoy mahjong games I won't be sticking with this one for very long.
Nor will I recommend any of the other Lost Lands games. I did try the Hidden Object and it's the same story line as this one. 
I was playing the Hidden Object game when I checked what other games they had and this one was listed as free. Since I'm not recommending the HO game either I figured I'd give this one a look and am not impressed nor do I recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096329690', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 5152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4834, 'last_played': 1584848554}
review:
It's a good Mahjong style game with a bit of a story line and quests to complete.  I really like that.

However, it's a pure mobile-style cash grab with an energy bar that time gates your ability to play.  I really hate that.

I would rather pay $10 and unlock the entire game to play when I want to rather than having to deal with playing three games and having to stop until tomorrow.

review: Chests are too big of a hassle to open.  Since you only have a limited amount of energy, I'd rather spend it playing mahjong than trying over and over to solve mini-games.  Besides the first easy chests the only way to solve them in the time allotted is to look up the answer.  Other than that I love the game.  If they eliminated the timer for opening chests it would be perfect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007415932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 114148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 497, 'last_played': 1625007685}

author: {'steamid': '76561198055528963', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 580, 'last_played': 1582079195}
review: The mahjong aspect of the game is fine. Beat timed puzzles to gain collection and building items, then use those items to advance in the game. Of course, there's a huge energy requirement. You need energy to attempt the puzzles and also to open chests. With full energy, you can play 3-5 puzzles/open chests. That's about half an hour, at best (if you're slow with the puzzles), of game play before waiting for more energy. I have a full-time job, so I get to play around 5 or 6 puzzles per day. Not great, but it is fun, when I have enough energy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064694458', 'num_games_owned': 69, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 20475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 734, 'last_played': 1693174696}
review:
Jeu gratuit de bonne qualité. Pour ceux qui, comme moi, ne veulent pas dépenser 0,01€ dans un "free to play", il suffit d'être patient, et de réfléchir un peu à l'ordre des missions et lieux explorés.
Je me fais 1 petite session tous les jours, c'est très agréable.
Par contre, je trouve le titre un peu "trompeur", car en dehors des tableaux de mahjong, il y a plein de mini-jeux (puzzles games) à faire (et ils ne sont pas faciles, de mon point de vue, en tout cas...)

author: {'steamid': '76561198341919074', 'num_games_owned': 520, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 9253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9253, 'last_played': 1579746631}
review:
Oynamayı az önce bitirdim. 154 saatlik oynayıştan sonra normal bir mahjong oyunu olduğunu söyleyebilirim, içerisinde size verilen görevler var. Ek olarak enerji kullanarak bazı durumlarda minik bulmacalar içeren sandıkları açmanız gerekiyor, benim sevdiğim bir kısım oldu sandık olayı. Görevleri takip ederek belirli seviyedeki mahjongları çözüyorsun. Genel olarak mahjong oynamayı seviyorsanız güzel bir oyun, ama oynayabilmek için enerjiye ihtiyacınız var ve enerji doldurmak için beklemeniz gerekiyor bu kısım oldukça sinir bozucu. Yeni oynamaya başladığınız zamanlarda bu bekleyiş sizi çok etkilemiyor ama eğer oyunun sonlarına yaklaşmışsanız göreviniz sizden 5 mahjong tamamlamanızı isterken, sizin tek bir mahjong oynayabilmek için neredeyse 4 saat beklemeniz gerekiyor (yeterli enerjiyi elde edebilmek için).  Enerji doldurma olayı olmayan bir oyunu tercih ederdim, ama günlük 10 dakika oynamak benim için sıkıntı değil diyorsanız tercih edebilirsiniz. 

English version of this comment:
I just finished the game. After 154 hours of gameplay i can say that it's regular mahjong game with different quests. Additionally, with using small amount of your energies you may have to open some chests which includes some mini-puzzles in it(Honestly i really enjoyed with those puzzles). It is pretty nice game if you like playing mahjong but it gives you cancer with energy(like stamina) filling cycle. It doesn't matter if you are a new player, but if you are about to finish the game you have to wait for energy filling for just one mahjong game for like 4 hours while your one quests telling you to complete 5 mahjongs. So i'd definetely rather a game that i don't have to wait for playing, but if you are okay with playing 10 min a day it is a nice game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009503230', 'num_games_owned': 1768, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 4215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4215, 'last_played': 1554989369}
review:
Bon petit jeu même si je trouve que les tableaux de mahjong peuvent être inutile difficile par moment surtout qu'on doit les répéter un certain nombre de fois en espérant que le hasard nous donnera les objets dont nous avons besoin. La petite astuce que je vous donnerai est que vu les tuiles sont les mêmes aux mêmes emplacements à chaque fois que vous faites le même tableau, ça peut finir par être facile de refaire les tableaux que vous arrivez à faire sans la moindre aide. Faut juste trouver ces tableaux-là et bon courage.
Les mini-jeux que nous avons grâce aux coffres sont sympathiques et varié, voir même à force plus agréable que les tableaux de mahjong.
Donc je vous conseille de quand même essayer le jeu mais d'apprendre la patience, à la fois à cause du système d'énergie et pour la difficulté présente.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013146396', 'num_games_owned': 1655, 'num_reviews': 2129, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1576971225}
review:
Слишком воняет Free-to-play: и туториалы эти для дураков, где тебя силой водят за руку; и бонусы всякие ресурсные, которые явно восполняются донатом; и общая карта мира, которая типа "показывают прогресс"; и уровни а-ля "на три звезды" (ну вы поняли, что добром это не кончится"; и daily-бонусы...

В мусор

author: {'steamid': '76561198118947058', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 24264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6337, 'last_played': 1709107730}
review: Игра вроде интересная, но есть "маленькое но"...хотя какой уж там "маленькое но", это "здоровеннищее НО" - донат. Это слово перечеркивает все удовольствие от игры, поскольку весь игровой процесс сводится к вливанию денег или адскому задротству - не хватает энергии, ресурсов и т.п. - покупай за реал деньги. Главное пометки нет "покупки внутри приложения". Этой игре самое место на мобильных телефонах играть. Я разочарован в этой игре.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008683738', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1576790986}
review:
Energy-gated puzzle games are the worst types of cancer. Why do I have this game, I literally blow through my energy in 1 minute and sit around like a walrus going 'UN! UN! UN!' for 30 minutes before I can play again.

It'd be an ok game if not for the pathetic cash grab store baggage they attached to the game. To make things even more hilarious, they made a bunch of these games! Bahaha, I'd rather dress up in a Donkey Kong mask and tie and run through my workplace naked. MonkaS, don't be sucked in by the pretty pictures and apparent story, anyone that needs a hero to finish mahjong games for them really isn't worth saving.

I'm sure someone out there thinks its fun to turn into a pillar of salt waiting to get their game on, but when the weekend comes and you just want to blaze out some non-stop gaming, troll micro-transaction games get the hulk-smash.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059740220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 16236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1709003442}
review:
I have never had this much fun playing mahjong in my life. Some will call it grindy..but I like Mahjong..so I dont feel a grind.

I love Mahjong and this game gives you quest and a purpose to solve the mahjong layouts. The only thing is you have energy, that gets used up when you solve a puzzle. It is constantly being regenerated albeit slowly. But you get enough to play an hour so AND the amount of energy you get increases with your level, so you get a kind of rpg for playing mahjong. The Artwork is VERY good, the intro story has art good enough to make you watch it a few times.

The sound is stellar. Matching tiles gives a ding whoosh type sound that is very satisfying. Plus there are birds chirping and other general pleasant events. the music is very pleasing to listen to while you take on the tiles.

You also have an inventory collections you must complete by solving mahjong layouts. weapons to banish beast for more collectible stuff. There are also different types of puzzles to solve to open treasure chest.

I am VERY pleased with this game..perfect 10/10.

Edit: some advice... dont try and fixate in the quest because it is definitely geared to try to encourage real money being spent. However if you just like to play mahjong and just be patient, things will unlock albeit over a lot of time. So I dont play it to try and complete it, Its just a great game when I feel like playing some mahjong

author: {'steamid': '76561198192775938', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 8092, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1611714310}
review:
Mahjong gameplay is fairly standard and works well. The game makes use of a quest-system that encourages you to play certain mahjong levels and complete other various tasks, which made the game more engaging for me, but also detracted from the relaxing puzzle aspect of the game. The game operates on an energy system, where you need energy to start a new puzzle, and you have to wait for energy to either recharge (can take a while at lower levels) or pay money to buy items that will give you energy; this was the biggest issue in the game for me, because, not wanting to spend actual dollars on in-game items, I had to essentially wait half a day before I could play the game again. 

tl;dr: fun mahjong title with a quest-like system, but pay-to-play aspects made it less relaxing and kept me from playing at times

author: {'steamid': '76561198214341973', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 24900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14580, 'last_played': 1577735970}

author: {'steamid': '76561198010162373', 'num_games_owned': 796, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 6659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6659, 'last_played': 1574529967}
review:
Exactly what it says on the tin: Mahjong in many different varieties, and other mini-games (in the form of "magic chests'). Great diversion, something I've played on my laptop while waiting for planes/trains, or while listening to music and relaxing in the evening. 

Like most free puzzle games, you have a health bar and an EXP bar; you get EXP, money and items from opening chests or completing puzzles, and then use these things to unlock new locations, finish quests or fight enemies. Chests and puzzles will also sap your energy, but if you log on regularly, you'll get daily rewards including energy energizers. Definitely one of the more balanced free-to-play puzzle games out there!
