review:
I enjoy Mahjong for short periods of time before or after more complex games.

This is a very good example of the genre as it introduces other elements, such as levelling up, finding materials to open new locations and collecting various items to complete sets.

You can pay to get extra items, but for the life of me at the level I am at I can't see why you would want to let alone need to.

If you like Mahjong I heartily recommend this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969796988', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1625405432}
review:
Spiele schon länger das Wimmelbildspiel von Lost Lands. Dieses Spiel ist jedoch bereits in der Anfangsphase recht hecktisch und schwer zu meistern. Ohne Zukäufe von Zeitverlängerungen ist es fast unmöglich,  alle Steinpaare von Tisch zu klicken. Und hier wird das als kostenlos angebotene Spiel zum Groschengrab.

Für mich ist das Spiel ein Zeitvertreib zwischendurch und wenn es wieder mal zeitlich nicht reicht, eine Aufgabe abzuschließen, dann versuch ich es am nächsten Tag erneut. Geld für Boni gebe ich deshalb nicht aus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198172469278', 'num_games_owned': 95, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1572914594}
review: Excelente jogo de memorização e rapidez lógica. O Jogo real chamado Mahjong é composto de 144 peças divididas por classes. Estou adorando este porque vc tem que ter agilidade e reflexo de memória. Nota 10, indico para quem gosta de desafiar a capacidade de raciocínio lógico. Além de mais uma vantagem que é gratúito.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108500915', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 10723, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 466, 'last_played': 1613041882}
review:
Für Mahjong Fans sicher eine Bereicherung. Schon der Start mit dem Überflug über die Elfenwelt mit Sprachausgabe hab ich mir gerne angesehen

Zum Spiel selbst: Wirkt wie ein RPG und Aufbauspiel. Durch lösen der Rätsel "kann" man Dinge erspielen die für die Reparatur und somit das Weiterkommen in der Geschichte braucht. Man selbst ist ein uralter Elfe der hunderte Jahre geschlafen hat und gerade jetzt wo ihn die anderen brauchen aufwacht. Spielwelt ist wie so oft eine Insel auf der die letzten Überlebenden Elfen gestrandet sind. Nette Spielwelt-Grafik mit Animationen die ich aber auch schon so in einfachen Flash-Games gesehen hab. Trotzdem nett gezeichnet. Vor allem die Hauptcharaktere sind grafisch ein Hingucker. Wie die Elfe mit so wenig Kleidung kämpfen soll ... naja, das hat sich schon irgendwie als Standard entwickelt das die Charaktere und da vor allem die weiblichen kaum was anhaben. Schön anzusehn ist es trotzdem.

Die Schwierigkeit des Spiels ist nicht nur das Mahjong zu lösen (was wirklich öfters nicht beim ersten Mal klappt) sondern auch das es auf Zeit geht. Je schneller gelöst desto mehr Sterne desto bessere Gewinne. Drei Sterne sind kaum zu schaffen, aber auch mit 2 Sternen kriegt man schon einiges was man braucht. Ansonsten muss man dort so lange weitere Rätsel lösen bis man das gewünschte Teil hat. 

Das Öffnen der Elfenkisten mit besonderen Teilen ist teils sehr schwierig!! Keine Mahjongg Rätsel sondern man muss auf Zeit!! farbige Punkte miteinander verbinden OHNE das die sich kreuzen!! So als Abwechslung wirklich schön aber schwierig.

Bin ja noch nicht so lange dabei, glaube Level 25, aber die Anforderungen steigen; von Neuling zu Erfahrener usw.

Leider wie bei vielen "kostenlosen" Games häufige Nachfrage etwas wie Booster oder ähnliches zu kaufen. 

Ich gebe trotzdem volle Punktzahl; vielleicht auch nur deshalb weil ich Mahjongg Fan bin.

Gruß Hayo23

review: I would highly recommend this to anyone who likes mah jong

author: {'steamid': '76561198000564950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 2252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 992, 'last_played': 1593612123}
review:
Is it a mobile type game that intends you to pay microtransactions to speed the game up?  Yes.
Does this prevent me from playing a bit of mahjong when I get home from work at night?  No.

Despite the obvious moneygrab design and strange story (it's almost charming even) this game gives you free mahjong matching puzzles and a few other similar casual puzzles to keep you entertained.  Reccomend from me if you're looking for a casual time killer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093157509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1668728775}
review: I was looking for free to play mahjong games to unwind, and this was the first one I found. It's surprisingly quality for a free game. The energy system is annoying, because I want to keep playing as long as I want, but I can understand how it's the game's only chance to make any money. The quests are fun and the setting is very enjoyable. It's clear effort was put into this despite being free. This was my first experience playing mahjong since 2 decades ago as a young child with my grandmother and it made my return to the classic game a very fond one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021538081', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 865, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1571529670}
review: Not a bad game, it starts a little slow with how many games you can play. Don't care for the plot much, and no POC that I've seen as of yet. Game play is standard, it's Mahjong. There's quests and item unlocks if you care about the story. Not a fan of the pay wall. Graphics are pretty, but with a whole deep story, I would have liked to see an optional skin for the tiles to actually match the story and make it feel more cohesive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198183896315', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1645777902}

review: It's a kinda kewl game .. tho i haven't really figured it all out yet.   It's sorta like mah Jong (the one person solitaire game) but you are given quests to do as a sideline (I guess .. like I said I haven't really figured it out yet!)   I was playing more just for the Mah Jong part and just recently started noticing the quests and stuff .. the mah jong part is timed .. so u have to try to hurry through it .. and I haven't found a way to undo your moves.   If you like the old mah jong solitaire game .. you'll probably like this1

review:
If you're looking for a relaxing game of Mahjong this is it. 
Music is quite relaxing and the levels are slightly getting more difficult when you gain XP. 
Sadly you only have x-amount of energy so you can't play endlessly unless you buy.
But overall I enjoy it :)

review: Nice Mahjong adventure game with a good story, coherent quests and different challenges to keep you moving around the kingdom.  Sometimes the tiles repeat which is a bit boring and the mini games went from basic level to blummin' difficult immediately!!  As you have limited mana to spend on opening the Mahjong games it does stop you playing obsessively, which is good.  I am enjoying it and will continue to play each day until I drain my mana dry.  Thanks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198205487672', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 7375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7320, 'last_played': 1566711069}
review: I recommend this game to anyone who wants to spend about 20-30 minutes a day playing something relaxing and easy. There are plenty of tasks and achievements, so you can play for a long time. The downside is that it's an energy based game, so each task/deck uses a chunk of your allotted energy, and then you have to wait for it to build back up before you can continue playing. You don't have to spend any money in the game to play, but there is the option to do so if you want to progress through the game faster. Overall, I have to say it was worth it for me.

review:
Overall, I like the game.
A big fan of Mahjong so I had no problems when I first started playing.
The achievements make you want to play more but unfortunately you will need to spend money as for the game is an "Energy" based game. Each deck you want to clear will consume a certain amount of energy and when it is all gone, well, you will have to wait till it refills or spend money to buy energy.
If you are looking for a relaxing game to play for like 15 to 30 minutes daily, well, this is definitely the game to play!!!

review:
The game itself isn't that bad and has some interesting concepts.  If your very patient, or only have a short amount of time to play daily, or have money to spend, then this might be a game you'll enjoy.
It relies heavily on micro-transactions, or making players wait to get enough energy.
Wells and energy expansions sites on map take a lot of materials to craft and probably only really helpful in the start when you can go up levels almost nonstop, but that leveling up without significant waiting time between levels is pretty much over by around level 8.

review: At first I really liked this game but after a bit it gets really frustrating for free players.  I can put up with the limited energy and having to farm levels to unlock new quests and areas. Once again a game that claims to be free but you can only really progress if you are willing to spend money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041779461', 'num_games_owned': 1015, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 7271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7271, 'last_played': 1557135515}
review: it seemed like a nice little f2p mahjong game at first . sure the engery system is a pain but its one of those they want your money so they try to entice you by being able to play more if you buy energy deals. if you only want to play a few games for a quick sitting its fine/easy enough. theres a story of some fashion that seemed fine  in a quest related way but the ending is a slong where you have to grind out materials and after playing 121hours and finding that out i can Not recommend this game.  just go buy a mahjong game with no energy mechanics like this f2p game with  a interesting gimmick ( like that one were you play levels to hatch a dragon for example from the early 2000s)  skip this game cause its just sad in the end when you think your gonna beat it then can't get a drop you need for a week.

review: Good tile matching game woven into a story with objectives. Essentially, you are sent on quests to gather materials or do certain things. To complete these objectives, you will play many, many tile matching mahjong games. It is fun but does get repetitive after a while. I don't necessarily like that you have to use "energy" to play the games and naturally, you are only given a limited amount of it each day. However, for a "free" game, I think this is a nice game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138620518', 'num_games_owned': 24, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 11385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 355, 'playtime_at_review': 1348, 'last_played': 1712318532}
review:
Ich habe selten so viel Freude an Mahjong gehabt :)

Nicht nur das man die Steine finden muss, sondern auch die Neben und Hauptaufgaben sind einfach tolle Entspannung pur.

Was mich allerdings stört sind die Trophäen . Besonders eine Nervt ungemein. Nämlich : Die Zeit ist abgelaufen.
Zeit abgelaufen... wobei man gar nichts dafür kann, wenn man keinen Zug mehr machen kann, weil die passenden Steine  fehlen. Das Spiel ist zu Ende. Aber gleichzeitig wird die Mission als Abgelaufen bewertet.

Aber sonst kann ich diese Version  sehr Empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069159152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2420, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1558718204}
review:
Nominally part of the Lost Lands series, this free-to-play game may deal with an underlying myth of the realm. You are the first Elven king, who has been destined to awaken in your people’s greatest need. Basically, you are Elven King Arthur (the once and future king). Anyway, the plot, while engaging, is secondary to the Mahjong scenes. See, this is basically similar to an old Facebook game, where you have some tools that can run out. Meaning, you can purchase more with gems, which likely can be purchased with actual cash.

So, while I recommend this title, be cautious, since being in the groove of these type games can be hazardous to your wallet… Also, the Mahjong games are MUCH more difficult than the Hidden Object scenes in the other free-to-play title.

author: {'steamid': '76561198191966722', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4148, 'last_played': 1553186846}
review: Игра из разряда "Не прошел,а отмучился"... Крайне не рекомендую ее тем,кто не хочет выносить себе мозг,нервы и тратить драгоценное время,которое можно с удовольствием потратить на что-то более полезное,увлекательное и интересное. Да,игра бесплатная,красивая,с достижениями,сама по себе неплоха,но если вы приходите сюда тупо за достижениями да еще любите поиграть в маджонг,то не думайте,что это будет очень просто или прохождение будет вам в кайф,как это видно на первый взгляд. К концу игры вы будете ее проклинать настолько,что ничто в этом мире не сравнится с этой игрой в этом плане. Более ужасно затянутого говна никогда не встречал в жизни. Получив последнее достижение,даже не стал проходить ее до конца,хоть и осталось 3 квеста (но это не точно). Теперь хоть можно поспать спокойно без головной боли и огня в одном месте.

review: Let's make something very clear that this isn't Mahjong but instead a puzzle game using Mahjong pieces. That being said, it's very enjoyable, keeps you thinking ahead and I appreciate it being energy based so you know when to take a break. The art is great as well. I don't care for the storyline so I tend to skip that part. I'm only here for the puzzles :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198093267975', 'num_games_owned': 1673, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1551371493}
review:
小时候我妈电脑里有一款叫“阿达连连看”游戏，我妈特爱玩那个，但我看着就烦，没有枪没有炮也能叫游戏？
十多年过去了，现在我也确实挺好玩的...
就是那个精力值系统太傻缺了，成年人愿意充点钱的，可以多玩几盘，小孩儿没钱就真的成了防沉迷了...
但我估计现在的小孩儿大多也不爱玩这种，就像我当年一样。

review: This is a variation on Lost Lands: Hidden Object Adventure. Now you have to solve Mah Jong Puzzles instead of finding hidden objects. Other than that everything else remains the same. It's a variation on a theme and may be more or less fun that LLHOA depending on your personal preference.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013132245', 'num_games_owned': 419, 'num_reviews': 316, 'playtime_forever': 518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1554096517}
review:
I was looking for a game that would exercise my memory, and what can beat Mahjong?  I'll tell you what can beat Mahjong:  SPEED MAHJON!

This is a great free game that includes Mahjong where you race against the clock to get that covetted 3 star score - and it's quite frantic.  There are also occasionally some other puzzle games (like a routing game, possibly others) in an RPG-like environment with resource gathering and building.

There is bonus stuff you can buy - but this (at least as far as I can tell so far) is not pay to play or pay to win.  It seems everything will eventually be accessible so it's play to play (if you want to call it that).

You really can't beat the price!

author: {'steamid': '76561198855989424', 'num_games_owned': 591, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 2086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2086, 'last_played': 1546986374}
review:
J'ai pas mal apprécié. très joli visuellement, agréable au gameplay, plutôt sympa dans le genre. De jolis succès à débloquer et des collections à terminer.   Pour les points négatifs, trop peu de temps de jeu, il faut régulièrement attendre le renouvellement de l'énergie et trop répétitif .Au bout d'un moment, un ras le bol s'installe.
Pour moi, 35 heures de jeu auront eu raison de moi. J'en ai bien profiter ceci dit; un sympa petit jeu gratuit. Je le recommande malgré tout !

author: {'steamid': '76561198167205092', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 559, 'last_played': 1553098820}
review: It's different then other Mahjong games. I enjoy playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058938486', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 4707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4656, 'last_played': 1547313809}
review:
Gra naprawdę dobra, jedna z aktualnie najlepszych mahjongów F2P na Steam (właściwie to jedyny grywalny). Prosta, na początku irytująca.

Sama rozgrywka jest naprawdę dobra, wzór płytek wyraźny, nie zlewających się (co o dziwo nie jest taką oczywistością przy innych grach tego typu). Szybko można przyzwyczaić oko i grać coraz szybciej, a przyda nam się to gdyż goni nas czas. Na każdą rozgrywkę mamy 10 minut z tym, że w mniej więcej połowie zaczynamy tracić gwiazdki które są nam potrzebne do zdobywania przedmiotów. Mamy też w czasie gry kilka wspomagaczy bez których w 80% rozgrywek można się obejść ale są ciekawym dodatkiem gdy na przykład masz „zły dzień”.

Prócz samego układania mahjonga jest też prosty ale ciekawy system RPG w której zdobywamy poziom postaci, odkrywamy nowe wioski, zabijamy potworki i wykonujemy questy które po pewnym czasie zaczynają irytować bo polegają na dosłownie 3-4 rzeczach które robimy w kółko ale nie można mieć przecież wszystkiego. Mamy też poziom staminy który na początku bardzo szybko nam spada poprzez układanie płytek i otwieranie skrzyń (które z kolei polegają na zupełnie innych łamigłówkach co jest fajną odskocznią od mahjonga).

Produkcja wygląda trochę jak port ze smartfonów, interfejs jest prosty do bólu – sprawia wrażenie projektowanego pod dotyk. Grafika jest ciekawa, bez wodotrysków, taka jaka powinna być. Oprawa dźwiękowa nie denerwuje (muzyczka w tle zaczęłam mnie wkurzać dopiero w jakieś 60 h gry), nie rozprasza.

Gra nie sępi o pieniądze, co prawdą są tam mikrotransakcje które na moim komputerze nawet nie dały się otworzyć i zrealizować ale nie było mi to za bardzo potrzebne. Jest też dodatkowa waluta którą też można zdobyć ze skrzyń lub przy zachowaniu ciągłości logowania do gry.

author: {'steamid': '76561198160867581', 'num_games_owned': 19, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4925, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 498, 'last_played': 1582278270}

author: {'steamid': '76561198157191965', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 5982, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5982, 'last_played': 1547316790}
review: This is one of those games where I wish it had a star system instead of the yes/no rating.  If it was a star system, say 1-5, I would give it a 2.  I am recommending it but only with certain caveats.: know that  "free to play" is the same as "fee to play".  We all know what I mean. And there is a lot of grind to the game which can be lessened by spending money.  That being said I did play it by only spending the virtual money in the game and got all the  Steam achievements at level 27 with 81 hours so it is possible to play without paying.  However the storyline is not complete nor the ingame achievements but I am deleting it from my library.  The grind has worn me down.  The graphics are very nice and the story is okay.  As long as you know what you are getting into and really love Mahjong...  By the way, the graphics, story, etc are exactly the same in Lost Lands: Hidden Object but the Steam achievements are easier to get in this game.

review: Es macht mehr Spass Mahjong zu spielen, wenn es eine Story im Hintergrund gibt. Die ist hier zwar vorhanden, aber es ist ein klares "Pay to Play" Spiel. Man hat nur begrenzt Energie und somit kann man jeweils nur kurz spielen bis diese schon wieder verbraucht ist. Ist schon klar, dass man auf diese Weise mehr Geld damit verdient, als wenn das Spiel von Anfang an einen fixen Betrag kosten würde. Ich werde mich deshalb nach einem anderen Mahjong Spiel umsehen, wo ich selber entscheiden kann, wie lange am Stück ich spielen will und nicht extra dafür zahlen muss.

author: {'steamid': '76561198253297104', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1050, 'last_played': 1563187966}
review:
Ha egy egyszerű unaloműző játékra vágysz, és szereted a mahjongot, akkor nem fogsz csalódni. Mivel ingyenes játék, nem meglepő, hogy limitált "energiával" futsz neki a kalandozásnak, ami csak lassacskán töltődik vissza, és plussz energiát és boostokat valós pénzért cserébe ajánlgat a játék - de nyilván, aki nem akar ilyesmibe beruházni, az úgy sem fog élni a lehetőséggel, és őszintén szólva egyáltalán nem is szükséges...
A sztori maga egy fantasy világban játszódik, és apránként halad előre, ahogy mahjongozás közben rádbízott feladatokat oldasz meg, jutalmakat szerzel stb. A mahjong mellett elég egyszerű fejtörő feladatok is felbukkanak,  ezek a ládanyitogató minigame-ek is elég szórakoztatóak.
Összességében ingyenes játékhoz képest kifejezetten igényesnek mondható - nem egy világmegváltó produktum, de nyilván nem is ez a célja.

author: {'steamid': '76561198358907891', 'num_games_owned': 926, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1543412535}
review:
Lost Lands Mahjong ist mein "All Time" lieblings Mahjong.
Die Stimmung, die das Spiel verbreitet ist phantastisch. Musik und SFX passen so gut zum Spiel.
Es ist mir immer wieder eine Freude eine Partie Mahjong damit zu spielen.
Das Ganze ist im "Lost Lands" "Universum" angsiedelt. Man erhält Quests, die man dann in Form von
Mahjong Partien lösen muss. Durch gefunden Truen und andere Gegenstände kann man nach und nach
Die Karte erobern und vergößern.
Das Spiel ist ein schier endloses Vergügen. Man muss aber wissen, dass die Steam Version einen "Energiebalken" hat.
Dieser verbraucht sich durch die Spielrunden und lädt zeitlich wieder auf.
Die CD Version hat dieses nicht - dafür ist die Steam Version ja auch kostenlos zu haben...
Klare Empfehlung dieses Spiel !

author: {'steamid': '76561198155079613', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 9267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4599, 'last_played': 1627856024}

author: {'steamid': '76561198199224666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 897, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 404, 'last_played': 1554048961}
review:
This caught my eye during the seasonal sale due to the RPG element. I've only played the versions that came stock with Windows over the years, and I find they get boring after a while. The story line here has been engaging enough to keep my curiosity, but I see plot holes in the interaction between the PC and the elven NPCs. if they were waiting so long/eagerly, then why the lukewarm (at best) welcome?

The gameplay itself is fairly straightforward, and the UI feels like most of the free games with micro-transactions. Too early for me to tell how heavily they "encourage" their use. The tutorials at least give you the option of earning an item rather than buying one for completion. 

The music and sound effects are pretty good. I was pretty entertained when my cat tried looking for the birds. ^.^

I tend to like collections and achievements, but everything is solely sorted by alphabet. I haven't seen an option to sort by completion yet, which would make it more comfortable. The inventory system has several categories, but suffers from the same/similar sorting problem. I suspect that it wouldn't feel so terrible if I were playing on a mobile device/tablet instead of  PC. 

Actually, I think that hit the nail on the head. This game feels like it's designed for mobiles/tablets, and the PC is an afterthought. It's not bad, but should be taken with a grain of salt.

review:
It's okay to kill some time in.  But it's full of the standard "freemium" annoyances, like the 'quest' that sent me here to write this review, popup "sales" and the standard microtransactions.  Also the base mahjong game is super dumbed down by highlighting valid tiles.  

Worth playing if you like Mahjong I guess, the story/items element is a little neat, just NEVER, EVER spend real money here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198295451717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1540308320}
review:
Ich habe Lost Lands: Mahjong und Lost Lands: A Hidden Object Adventure angespielt.

Beide sind mit einer völlig belanglosen Hintergrund Story um Elfen aufgepeppt, aber dies hat nicht mehr Bedeutung als das hübsch Packpapier bei einem Geschenk. Zum Thema hat es dann nichts beizutragen.

Die Story ist übrigens bei beiden Spielen die gleiche.

Sehr nervig fand ich bei beiden Spielen den laufenden Countdown Timer. Dadurch wird aus den eigentlich zur Entspannung gedachten Hidden Object und Mahjong Erlebnissen einfach nur Stress.

Bei Hidden Object sind die Konturen der zu suchenden Teile schlecht an die realen Fundstücke angepasst. Auch das nervt.

Und das Blabla um begrenzte Spielzeit und der Druck, dass man 'gerne wiederkommen' kann, macht mir diese Spiele auch nicht sympathischer.

Nachdem ich dann noch gelesen habe, dass diese Spiele letztlich Pay To Win Spiele sind, sind sie für mich final gestorben.

Spiele werden deinstalliert, der Plattenplatz ist mir mehr wert.

Es gibt übrigens im Netz legale Freeware Spiele sowohl in der Art Mahjong wie auch Hidden Objects, die mit weniger Buhau auskommen und sich angenehm spielen lassen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198227513736', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1540131408}
review: Spodobała by mi się ta gra gdyby nie to że jak nie ma już klocków które pasują do siebie to można je wymieszać tylko pyłem magnetycznym który można kupić za kryształy a jak się nie ma pyłu to trzeba robić mahjong-a od początku, gdzie traci się energie i czas, co jest irytujące. Kolejnym minusem jest to że fabuła jest taka sama jak w Lost Lands A Hidden Object Adventure które zacząłem grać wcześniej tylko tam zamiast mahjong-a szukamy ukrytych przedmiotów. Przyrost energi która jest potrzebna do gry też nie jest za szybki także zrobi się parę partyjek i trzeba robić przerwę. Ogólnie nie polecam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061200283', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1537738287}
review:
While this game has good graphics and some fun puzzles, I had a bad time playing it.
I didn't like that every puzzle is on a timer - I was expecting a laid back game but got a ticking clock.

If you don't like playing against a clock - or having a limited amount of "energy" to do so-and-so many puzzles in one sitting, before the energy replenishes - then I would advise aginst this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198186573434', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 2022, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1593683284}
review:
Обычный маджонг. Красочная графика, пародия на сюжет и бл*$#@^% байты на донат. Иногда игра прям орёт: "ДАЙ МНЕ ДЕНЯГ!!!11!!1!"

А теперь внятно
Как по мне главная проблема игры - зависимость от энергии. Много гринда, бывают непроходимые уровни(рандомжеж), и несколько докучающий звуковой фон. Но невозможность просто засесть на час это главная проблемма. При наличии шафлов, на один стол уходит три минуты.

Однако плюсы таки перевешивают. Игра бесплатная, глаза не режет, а звук можно выключить(в отличие от надоедливых предложений покупки дребедени)

author: {'steamid': '76561198129580148', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1533395259}

author: {'steamid': '76561198063804851', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1533360393}
review:
Good lord, where to begin? I just wanted to play Mahjong, not all this fiddle-faddle. A huge, tedious intro that can't be escaped and then a huge inventory screen filled mess with multiple game types. Little did I know that a game that presented itself as Mahjong would present other types of puzzles. Had I wanted such I'd have looked for a game that offered them. 

The game itself I can't find fault with, for what it is. But the UI is unwieldy at best and alas I loaded the game too late to refund I suspect. I can't say I've ever tried to get a refund, but this is a game I'm going to uninstall and never look upon again If I can help it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052277476', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5508, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3080, 'last_played': 1689578242}
review:
I REALLY liked the game at first, but I find myself wishing they'd sell me an "I own it" version, so I could just PLAY! Same goes for Forge of Empires... lol! What "does" get my goat though, is for the second time in 2 days, I got caught up in a glitch in the algorithm while playing offline, where I had 3 "out of moves" endings in a row, only this second time; I had the same exact "fail" tile setup on the second & third "explores" which prompted me to log on, and write this review! CLEAN IT UP GUYS!

AUG 12th - Up to level 13 now, but the "antics" NEVER stop! Got burned on a tile set, tried again, got the hidden paired on each other at the bottom, only to be stalled with no more moves, 2 moves later. This game is meticulously calculated and measured with reference to the tile sets, as to maximize sales, while minimizing offense, by providing "normal" tile sets the majority of the time, and taking back 95% of what's given as "free".

*UPDATE 1 Aug 2018*
This is the first time I've ever felt so strongly about a game I'm "trying" to play! These people aren't game writers, they're carnival masters, plain & simple. I meant to update my review yesterday after having an obvious pattern of; 2 losses, 2 wins, 2 losses, and two more wins! I halted the losing streak/pattern by "spending" freebies (MAGIC SHUFFLE BAG) ! JUST NOW; I HAD 4 LOSSES IN A ROW WITH 2 MATCHING TILES ON TOP OF EACH OTHER;  THE LAST 3 BEING THE SAME EXACT TILE LAYOUT, WITH TWO MATCHING TILES, LAYING ONE, ON TOP ANOTHER AT THE END OF THE SET, SIMPLY BECAUSE I DIDN'T HAVE A MAGIC BAG HANDY TO SHUFFLE THE CARDS!

*update* After my review update.
I went back a few hrs later to try again, and got the SAME PAIR STACKED TOGETHER IN THE SAME POSITION TO PREVENT ME FROM PROGRESSING! I SPENT MY LAST 6 *FREE* CRYSTALS TO SHUFFLE THE TWO TILES IN ORDER TO BREAK FREE OF THEIR "MONEY TRAP"! * TO THE CARNIVAL MASTERS; *NOT ONE RED PENNY!*

*UPDATE AUG 3RD*
AS OF RIGHT NOW; I HAVE ACCESS TO 3 AREAS TO START A GAME OF "free" MAHJONG, WITH 2 BEING LOCKED BY PERPETUALLY-REPEATING TILE SETS THAT END WITH A PAIR OF TILES STACKED, AND THEM WANTING ME TO BUY CRYSTALS TO "RESHUFFLE". THIS GAME STEALS RIGHT IN FRONT OF YOU! I managed to purchase the blacksmith which is supposed to make a weapon every 3 hrs. So I then played 3 consecutive losing games (same tile set all 3 times), then switched to the only area I'm still allowed to play, and won that game in 4 1/2 minutes. All told; about 15 - 20 minutes. I then checked my new blacksmith; Only 2 - 1/2 minutes had expired on the clock!

*update Aug 4 2018*
I made it to level 8, purchased the farm with free crystals and.... 4 losing tile sets in a row! I now have 3 out of 4 areas to play mahjong that have locked me out UNTIL I pay! I just had to PAY to get the new area (farm) to play, and now I have to "pay to play"? Sounds like a "FOUNDATION" not a "free to play" game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198174144566', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 17016, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1314, 'last_played': 1580496511}
review:
Was mir gut gefällt ist die Mischung aus RPG und dem klassischen Gesellschaftsspiel des Mahjong, und einigen anderen kleinen Herausforderungen. Die Achievements  funktionieren zuverlässig, und durch die Steamcloud ist Speichern am PC nicht notwendig.
Es empfiehlt sich ein wenig Münzen und Kristalle mit echtem Geld zu bezahlen, das spart doch deutlich Zeit. Nach drei Tagen war das Zeitlimit dann meisten kein Problem mehr, und wenn doch, haben die 60 s Zeitstop dafür gesorgt, dass Wiederholungen vermieden werden können.

Eine annehmbare Graphik mit sphärischen musikalischen Klängen runden das Spielerlebnis ab.

author: {'steamid': '76561198844380263', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1662, 'last_played': 1534787707}
review: I love Mahjong games, and this is one of the very best as far as visual is concerned.  The tasks are fun, but the mahjong games themselves need to have more variety when you play at each location.  They should be a new layout each time, instead of the same one (or so it seems to me).  Also, I really am frustrated by running out of game time and having to wait for it to build up again.  The other Mahjong game I like to play allows unlimited game play, but restricts advancement until I beat each game.  I prefer this since I will play each game over and over until I master it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198242504012', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 13616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4944, 'last_played': 1612959157}
review: Отличный маджонг с богатым выбором раскладов, вписанный в историю освоения заколдованных земель, населенных нежитью. Весьма долгая и красочная игра, но довольно быстро скатывающаяся в однообразие. Серьезное ограничение по затратам энергии на каждый расклад быстро приводит к одному из двух вариантов действия: необходимости внутриигровых покупок или мухлежу с временем/датой на компьютере. Это подбешивает. А так - хорошее бесплатное развлечение. Всем добра.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125503772', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1103, 'last_played': 1576958313}
review:
Il buon vecchio Majong intessuto in una storia che sa farsi apprezzare.
Un ottimo passatempo e siceramente non capisco chi si lamenta per la possibilità di "fare acquisti" per almeno due motivi:
- dato che non c'è la pubblicità in qualche modo chi lavora deve essere pagato ;
- non spendere può essere un ottimo modo per evitare di impegnare troppo tempo in un videogioco e goderselo in pace un po' al giorno.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106430898', 'num_games_owned': 231, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 8099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3202, 'last_played': 1585005011}
review:
El juego en general, me gusta mucho. Buen trabajo Diseñadores.
Lo que no me gusta es la barra de energía, mientras vas subiendo las misiones de nivel, más energía cuesta, lo que significa que solo te llegará para jugar a pocas misiones. Tengo 260 energía y solo por jugar una misión, me cuesta 60 energia, eso me dará para 4 misiones, pero aún es peor porque cuando pierdes, te quedas sin recuperar la energía gastada ni nada.
Si quitan la barra de energía o disminuyen el coste de energía, el juego sería mejor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198339095067', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 25704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1625, 'last_played': 1595768670}
review:
c'est un très bon jeu
 et je ne m'attendais pas vraiment a un doublé en partie RPG et majhong
c'est adictif a mort (si on aime les deux genres)
juste un reproche : pas assez de temps  (pour moi qui suis chez moi MAIS pour les gens au boulot là c'est génial)
évidement le manque de temps peut se rattraper par des achats en monnaie réel  HI HI HI vive l'arnaque
mais enfin c'est un jeu a la base "gratuit" donc faut pas trop en demander
c'est donc un  jeu beau et très sympa

author: {'steamid': '76561198053878761', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2824, 'last_played': 1559421321}
review:
The cash shop is way too visible: whenever you connect, you have a first add, then you enter in the game, and you have a second add "because you have a promotion whenever you gain a level".

The game is based on farming, but most of the activities are consuming energy. The farther you go, the more expensive it is. So basically, you can make 2 or 3 games of mahjong the morning and the evening...

Then, there are little things that are a bit boring (not big things, but still):
- MahJong grids are not random.
- You have to know somes grids by heart, because you will only notice at the end that two tiles of the same kind are one on each other. And since the amount of games is really limited, it increases the frustration (it is on purpose)
- If you fail a grid, you have an item (received by gift or by purchase) that allow you to continue the game. Most of the time, you must use 4 of those because after the 'reroll of remaining tiles" it is still not possible to succeed.
- Whenever you alt+tab (or clic on another window if you play in windowed mode), the game is paused. But the pause does not work in the game (timer continues), and what is the reason to pause when you are on the "receiving/loot" screen?

author: {'steamid': '76561198217493944', 'num_games_owned': 107, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1588202601}
review:
Really relaxing game lots of fun
HOWEVER there are some pros and cons
Pros:
Easy to learn 
fun story so far
Great creative usage of gameplay
Plus there are mini games and puzzles and other game play mechanics not just mahjong

Cons:
Since this is Free To Play I can't blame them for doing this but there are in game purchases and sometimes with chests or deals the game can be a little pushy
Your energy can go really fast and having to pay for energy stinks but it's not too hard to get more energy with in game items you can get from enemy drops ect.
When you retry a level it will sometimes shuffle tiles but sometimes it won't which I think is odd as I believe should each time.

In the middle not pro or con
Also writing a review becomes a quest later on (doing that now) so I think it's a great way to write a review for the game and more people will likely do it because there is a reward but at the same time it does give off a mobile game begging for reviews and 5 stars when it doesn't deserve it.
I think weapon drops should be more common as I normally pay gold for weapons.

Some tips save your gold unless you really need it don't waste it.
Don't waste all your items either some items can only be bought with diamonds an in game purchasable item.

Conclusion I believe the game is a fun and relaxing game that offers new puzzles and challenges while also keep you on your feet as you are time with each puzzle. More time is added with each level so time so far has not been an issue. The core gameplay is great and offers a challenge.

If I gave this a rating on a 5 point scale I would say 3.5 as it does have a "mobile game feel" to it and the whole limit to the energy. 1 quest could wipe out more than half of your energy which is a little annoying. Incase anyone is wondering I am lvl 5. The final issue that keeps me from rating this a 4/5 is the constant hey check out our new game or hey new price drops or constant advertisement of the devs games. Not saying it's a bad thing but there are subtle ways of advertising take TF2 for example the awpers hand was an in-game item that was a reference to the awp in csgo. I used valve as an example but video game developers, companies, and studios have been doing this for years.

author: {'steamid': '76561198386715888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 10690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5279, 'last_played': 1578010730}
review: Divertido para pasar el tiempo, incluso tiene historia, algo de publicidad pero muy buen juego.

review:
it's an alright game.
you can really only play a few levels a day until your energy runs out and you have to wait hours for it to restore.(unless you are willing to pay money) 
yes you gain more energy as you level up but then the levels require more energy to play.
i find this terribly annoying as once you start getting hooked on playing you're out of energy and must wait several hours to continue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198205688405', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 3623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3605, 'last_played': 1518191735}
review:
Фірма Five-BN, мабуть, робила браузерні ігри, але зараз випускає їх у Steam. Отже, зустрічайте чергову гру про Загублені землі [b]Lost Lands: Mahjong[/b].
Є у нас карта, на карті локації. Коли заходимо в локацію, то граємо у маджонг. Можемо побачити як традиційні популярні фігури, так і нові, є навіть український тризуб. На вирішення головоломки дається 10 хвилин, я знімала всі кості за півтори-три хвилини. Існує можливість перемішати все, якщо зайшли у глухий кут; це не безкоштовно, звісно. Дуже дивно, що взагалі немає функції скасувати один останній хід, у маджонгу це важливо.
Крім власне китайської гри, наявні також монстри, які вештаються стежками, та скрині, які відкриваються за енергію. Так, тут є енергія, яку ми витрачаємо на виконання дій. І щоденні бонуси. І покупка всілякого непотребу, без якого можна обійтись. Пригадуєте, що я казала про браузерні ігри? Скрині відкриваються також після розгадування головоломок, але цього разу не маджонгу. Якщо відкрити скриню швидко, то зекономлену енергію не повернуть, що, як на мене, вельми журно. А ще після певного етапу настає епоха восьмигодинних квестів. Причому вони можуть бути такі: спочатку ми збираємо 10 мечів, якими проганяють кобольдів, і їх у нас забирають, а наступний квест буде "прогнати 7 печерних кобольдів". Та як його виконати, трясця, якщо я вже десяток мечів викинула в трубу? Насправді кожне 8-годинне завдання містить три малі задачі, і не завжди вистачає часу та енергії на виконання їх усіх. Що роблять "сонячні кристали", які видаються як винагорода за ці завдання, я так і не дізналась.
І, так як у цій грі є подоба сюжету ("сюжетні" завдання створені за класичним шаблоном РПГ [i]"піди туди, бо я сам не можу"[/i]), і тексту багато, то сильно впадає у вічі, що українська локалізація тут, гм... непрофесійна. А ще я відмовилась від завантаження збережень у "хмаринку", і, не знаю, чи з моєї вини, чи ні, вони злетіли, і все, кінець. Заново почати не можу, бо навчання зіштовхнулось із повислим восьмигодинним квестом. Ну, хоча б досягнень отримала.

[u]Підсумок: солідні ґеймери у таке не грають.[/u]

author: {'steamid': '76561198109987388', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1517964916}
review:
It's a good enough game as in it is exactly what you think it is and functions well enough, but i wouldn't recommend it.  instead of easing you into the more challenging puzzles to get you used to it, it just starts off on hard mode to entice you into spending money on it.  you can only attempt a certain number of times before it drains your "stamina" and you either have to wait an absurd amount of time or spend your premium currency to buy more.  

if you just want to play a puzzle game, i suggest you look for one that isn't designed to bilk every last cent out of you.  this is just a cash grab with a pretty skin over it.

review: I wish the energy was easier to get, or uploaded faster, or anything else to extend game play, but other than that I enjoy the game. ---- I'm editting my review after more game play. I'm only at level 11. It takes forever to level up, even with buying the stupid gem packs. I'm not sure this game is worth it, unless you're okay with pay-to-play. It's a shame that there is so much waiting for energy because it would be a much better game if you actually got to play more than sets of mahjong every 30 minutes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096305141', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 430, 'playtime_forever': 29625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1668642895}
review:
Pra que que eu fui baixar isso, pra terminar esse tipo de jogo certeza que vai ser umas 300 horas pra mais. (É porque eu gosto de terminar o que eu começo [ninguém liga]).
Pra conseguir as coisas tu precisa repetir o mesmo local mais de 10 vezes e ainda diz que tu pode ganhar mais de 5 coisas no local e tu só ganha 1. ATNC.
As imagens são bonitas e legais e o melhor é que é legendado PT, é até mais bem feito que Twilight Town, mas hoje meu voto é não.
Jogar no trabalho, é claro que pode. kkkkkkkkkkkkkkkk

author: {'steamid': '76561198213142187', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1533610702}

author: {'steamid': '76561198057575879', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 7220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7220, 'last_played': 1516789746}
review:
Każdy aspekt tej gry z premedytacją wymyślony został tak by maksymalnie zmęczyć i zirytować gracza by ten z tej całej frustracji sięgnął do portfela i kupił pakiet złota lub waluty premium. Można grać bez tego, jednak im dalej tym ciężej bo radość z odkrywania i rozgrywki zastępuje gniew kiedy to trzy dni zajmuje ci farmienie jakiś drabinek by wejść do nowo otwartej lokacji... Sytuacji nie poprawia fakt że kiedy gra zaczyna cię wciągać kończy ci się energia i trzeba zrobić kilku godzinną przerwę na jej odnowienie albo kupić odnawiające ją przedmioty. Mechaniki nastawione na mikrotranzakcje psują przyjemność z rozgrywki i przesłaniają ciekawy pomysł oraz ładną, kolorową grafikę.

Spędziłem z grą 120 godzin ale mniej więcej od połowy tego czasu musiałem się zmuszać do gry żeby zdobyć wszystkie odznaki, po ich pozyskaniu nie planuję więcej wracać do tej produkcji. Będę ją wspominał słodko-gorzko, ale polecić jej nie mogę.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001453717', 'num_games_owned': 1387, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 4005, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1844, 'last_played': 1592212229}
review:
Shanghai solitaire on a timer, with the common freemium model of limited, slowly replenishing energy that you can buy refreshes of. You can obtain (or pay money for) helpful items like hint bugs that fly around matches for you, hourglasses that give you more time, and magnetic dust that reshuffles the tiles, but no undoes.

Almost identifcal to their [url=store.steampowered.com/app/392950]Lost Lands: A Hidden Object Adventure[/url], except its hidden object levels have been replaced by Shanghai solitaire levels. Same story, same graphics, same music, same quests. If you've played one, you've essentially played them both.

So how's its solitaire? It assumes you know how to play Shanghai solitaire; no instructions are available. Its Shanghai solitaire levels choose a random formation from a wide variety of layouts. Uses traditional mah jongg tile designs with Chinese numbers and season names, with no alternate tile sets. Wrong moves can render your level unwinnable, which you may not discover for minutes, playing until the game acknowledges you have no moves left and gives you the option to buy a reshuffle or start over (if you have enough energy). Its reshuffles apparently don't ensure the new board is solvable: I've used a reshuffle, played the only four moves I saw, then had the game again declare no moves left and offer to sell me another reshuffle. 

While other players may not mind the countdown timer, personally, I hate playing Shanghai for speed with no undoes when I make a hasty mistake. If you too would like variant tile sets and undoes, there are many inexpensive non-free alternatives on Steam.

Me, I'd play Lost Lands's hidden-object version over this one. Things I like about this game, like some of its music (at least, the tracks that aren't trying to manufacture tension), its decent graphics, and its treasure chest puzzles, were all taken from that one, anyway. But if you want a quick fix of Shanghai solitaire without cheaty undoes, that cuts you off after a few rounds till your energy bar refills, this game'll give that to you for free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017487615', 'num_games_owned': 761, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1514765751}
review:
This game has a very cool story and well-done graphics. It mixes the traditional match-board MahJong levels with some very nice ColorFlow/CrossPath line puzzles to unlock new things.
Although I really love the story and the general gameplay of this game, the "limited energy" scheme is very irritating to deal with. It's pretty much one of those Windows Store / Facebook / Mobile games that make you spend money if you want to play more than a certain limited number of matches per time. If you play it very casually, you won't suffer much with this taken that MahJong matches take some time to finish in general (though limited here by a timer, which combined with the energy scheme is really ridiculous). Yet I do recommend playing this game coz of the story and gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198388526044', 'num_games_owned': 48, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 10689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9576, 'last_played': 1572576480}
review:
Totally doable without buying anything or spending money on it, but you gotta be patient the time to fully recharge your points to be able to actually continue to play different mahjong sets at different territories can be very long. It's more a cell phome app. game than a steam game i would say as for the general feeling of it. But if you enjoy the mahjong game by itself, this one is catchy with the addition of all the quests (feels sometime like fetching tho) and discovering areas with different characters.

the one thing that bugged me the most about the game is the mouse control. it is soooooo slow. Playing with the mouse sensitivity didnt changed anything. it is kinda annoying.

Enjoy ! Had it for free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148919447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1047, 'last_played': 1599248884}
review:
Для меня плюсы этой игры перевешивают минусы. Но все-таки эта игра не настолько хороша, чтобы рекомендовать ее другим.

Плюсы: 
1) Это маджонг, в который можно играть бесплатно.
2) Графика смотрится довольно приятно

Минусы:
1) Основная моя проблема с этой игрой - слои костей реализованы плохо. Иногда клик промахивается мимо цели, хотя курсор явно находится на костяшке - надо целиться ближе к центру. А еще довольно сложно понять, сколько костей лежит под той, что я снимаю - одна или две, или даже ни одной
2) Игра это из тех условно-бесплатных, которые очень хотят получить ваши деньги. Основная проблема - в том, что где-то через полчаса-час игры у вас закончится энергия и придется либо отложить маджонг до следующего дня, либо платить. Внутриигровая валюта закончится быстро, так что платить придется деньгами.
3) При каждом запуске вылезает реклама и интро - нельзя сразу начать играть, надо каждый раз пропускать все это
4) Сюжет и квесты выглядят прикрученными сбоку и очень картонными.

author: {'steamid': '76561198380380314', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 777, 'playtime_forever': 1354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1615392597}

author: {'steamid': '76561198413987657', 'num_games_owned': 3035, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 43027, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28990, 'last_played': 1513053987}
review:
Originally I was just looking for a game to play for in-between, with little fuss and low setup. Somehow I ended up sinking a lot of time into this game instead. As with many F2P games you end up spending a lot of time on it initially to maximize your energy refills etc, but as you progress and get a larger energy bar, it gets a lot relaxter because you can leave it alone for half a day and still not have your energy maxed out.

The graphics and sound are beautiful and the quests give you something to aim for while you are matching your tiles. The treasure chest minigames are quite a nice break from the tiles as well, so it won't feel too monotonous. Since characters and environments are animated, nothing feels stale.

The quests are arguably one of the best things about this game, but timed quests can be unfair at times, because they may request items from areas that you reached the level for, but cannot access yet (due to not being able to find the needed unlock item until the story quest asks for it - trust me, you'll likely be above the level you needed by the time you actually unlock it). So if you don't plan on spending money on the game, prepare for a long grind for some of these. Especially since timed quests that ask for collections only add priority to the items of the first collection in the quest, but not the second (and at times, third). I've wasted a lot of energy on the right locations only to come up empty handed.

If you're okay with slow progression (especially at higher levels) and don't mind sinking some time into this, and of course if you love tile-matching, then this game is definitely one of your nicer picks.

Pros
[list]
    [*]Beautiful art
    [*]Ambient sound
    [*]Quests give your tile matching purpose
    [*]Free to Play
    [*]Game auto-pauses if you need to switch tabs (e.g. get a skype call etc)
    [*]Chest Mini-Games take away from potential monotony
[/list]

Cons
[list]
    [*]Time Quests need some fixing
    [*]You'll constantly be reminded that you can spend money on this (don't get me wrong, I understand the need for that, but it can be annoying, especially when the special deals pop up every new level you hit)
    [*]Trying to get the Collection items you need can be quite frustrating
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198116704169', 'num_games_owned': 907, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 5127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3772, 'last_played': 1692257784}
review:
Wer gerne Mahjong spielt wird begeistert sein, das Spiel lässt sich komplett kostenlos durchspielen man kann aber auch den Ablauf durch Käufe beschleunigen. Es müssen immer Ressourcen, Waffen, Kristalle und verschiedenste Dinge eingesammelt werden um manche Orte zu betreten bzw. weiterzukommen. Da die Energie, die man um Levels zu starten sich nur über längere Zeit wieder auffüllt kann man jeden Tag nur einige Levels machen, zumindest wenn man kostenlos spielt.
Aber auf jedenfall empehlenswert für immer mal Zwischendurch,,,

author: {'steamid': '76561198031204140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 4673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2774, 'last_played': 1515558671}
review:
I would recommend against this game because it is not programmed to check if the Mahjong stacks can be completed. Over and over again I have had Mahjong rounds where I got halfway through, had no more moves, used the reshuffle item -- and after three moves I had no viable moves again. That indicates to me that these configurations are broken.

I have put in a lot of hours on this game because I like trying to get all achievements in a game (so far, anyway) and these are easy to achieve -- assuming you can get anything done. The more I play this the more I feel I am trying to work around the basis of the game, solving Mahjong stacks, because if I just do that, I fail too often to get any further in the game. This is too hard and too frustrating.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118473843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 704, 'last_played': 1513824256}
review:
Very tentative recommendation because it's free, with one big caveat: this is the same game as their previous "Lost Lands: A Hidden Object Adventure," just with mahjong instead of HO scenes. The scenario, quests, chest puzzles -- completely identical, so if you've already played that, there will be no surprises here (and you might already be sick of it).

On the bright side, since a mahjong game takes longer than a HO scene, the energy refresh rate is less immediately frustrating; you can actually play the game for 20-30 minutes before your energy runs out. Also they appear to have set the Steam achievements to trigger when you hit the first milestone in a repeating goal, instead of the fifth one, so it's much quicker to get achievements out of.

author: {'steamid': '76561198238513154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1510411231}
review: Davvero un ottimo passatempo ! Rilassante e non troppo difficile . La grafica è molto carina ed il fatto che bisogna ottenere dei materiali per sbloccare aree nuove oppure costruire pezzi di mappa come case , mulini , ecc... rende questo gioco piacevole ed interessante . Certo che se si vuole progredire in modo più veloce bisogna spendere , ma allo stesso tempo ci si può giocare rilassandosi un oretta o due al giorno senza dover spendere credito reale . Consigliato !

author: {'steamid': '76561197970304442', 'num_games_owned': 767, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 18810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18550, 'last_played': 1527437820}
review:
Für zwischendurch ganz nett aber man kommt doch recht schnell an die Zahlgrenze und da stellt sich einem die Frage ob man mit einem gekauften Game nicht doch besser bedient ist da dort keine " Wartezeit " entsteht. Wer nur mal nen Stündchen am Tag / Woche daddelt kann ja einen Blick riskieren und könnte Gefallen daran finden. 

Da das Game als solches " Gratis " ist kann man es durchaus mal anspielen aber ohne Zahlungen wird es mit der Zeit doch langatmig, daher doch eher keine Empfehlung wegen der  Einschränkungen " Pay to Win ".

Am Anfang noch einigermaßen spielbar aber mit dem Fortschritt verheizt man in sinnlose Punkte in unnütze Aktionen die am Ende für wichtige Sachen fehlen und nur mit Bargeld auszugleichen sind oder langer Wartezeit für neue Aufgaben.


Für Gratis ist es am Ende zu teuer wegen der ewig nötigen Einzahlungen und man bekommt bei Aktionen nicht wirklich immer die Items die man braucht. Als Fazit daher lieber in der Nase bohren da hat man immer einen Gewinn!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198075246752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1509216322}
review:
A good-looking mahjong game with a bit of a fantasy story.
Spiced up a bit with some other kinds of puzzles. Don't come up too often, but a nice change every now and then.
Collecting resources to further the story and to help with the mahjong itself adds some nice variability as well.

If you don't mind the wait for the energy to refill, it's a varied and pretty way to play some mahjong.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011807830', 'num_games_owned': 652, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 997, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 997, 'last_played': 1508971654}
review:
Kinda insidious. If the puzzle shuffles in a way that makes it impossible to complete, you have to pay to reshuffle it and keep going. Attempting it anew wastes the "energy" spent. Paying to reshuffle a puzzle does not guarantee it'll be possible to complete, so the sunk cost fallacy will quickly rob you.

On top of that, you have to grind puzzles for RNG reliant items to progress, artificially lengthening gameplay... Or, again, you can pay real money to bypass an artificial problem.

I get that this is meant to be freemium, but that's not a very nice first impression.

EDIT: After delving deeper, yup, I can confirm that the puzzles are static. And on top of that, a very common tactic they employ to waste your resources is stacking two of the exact same tile on top of one another.

For example; let's say there are four green dragon tiles. Three of them are exposed, so you match two of them. Then, you'll see the fourth appear from underneath one of the two you just removed. That means you had a 33.3% chance to make the game unwinnable in that particular instance, and no way to combat it without either cheating or forking over some cash.

Dirty tactics indeed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198434591096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 850, 'last_played': 1518718548}

author: {'steamid': '76561198068711646', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 7211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6009, 'last_played': 1508723198}
review: O Jogo é bom, porém por ser de graça, você joga uns 4 a 5 rounds e tem que parar esperando a energia recarregar. O preço das moedas do jogo e dos cristais para comprar itens dentro do jogo são caros, mas da para ganhar alguma coisa de graça a cada dia iniciando o jogo, da um item por dia de graça. O problema é que algumas vezes o jogo fica sem solução e você perde o round, principalmente quando você tem cristais para gastar...não sei se o jogo é programado para fazer você gastá-los, a impressão que fica é que sim. Recomendo, pois por ser de graça, da para se divertir bastante, é só ter um pouco de paciência e não querer zerar o jogo em poucas horas, pois isto é impossível.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056589339', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1393, 'last_played': 1507684859}
review:
This game is tons of fun for mahjong players. The story line and "quests" have me bouncing all over a large map fixing things and completing puzzles. My only complaint is the puzzles are timed. No casual play.

Think Age of Empires meets your favorite mahjong title. This game takes a long time to finish. There is a pay to play option for bonuses; however, the game can be played without them. I look forward to exploring more from this publisher and want to support them financially.

author: {'steamid': '76561198191721405', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 7863, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1546376542}
review: The concept of the game is good, there are lots of different pieces to it, not just mahjong. And the price is right (free). But I find it aggravating that you can't just sit and play through the game, as you have an energy limit that requires leveling to refill. You can spend gems if you have them to purchase energy concoctions in the store, but you rarely receive gems in the game. You can spend real money to purchase them, but to me, that defeats the purpose of a free game. This is why I don't enjoy games on FB...you have a limited time to play before you have to stop and replenish unless you want to spend cash. My preferred play style is to play through a game as much as possible as I have the time. To have to stop after a few interactions removes the enjoyment for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198286350229', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 9847, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9821, 'last_played': 1558861537}

review:
Mahjong RPG basically, do 'Quests' and advance, yes theres micro transactions, (its a free game they need to make money somehow) played for 90 mins so far, havent needed to use them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036328736', 'num_games_owned': 3959, 'num_reviews': 727, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1504301369}
review:
ATTENTION : Bien qu'il s'appelle aussi Lost Lands, comme "Lost Lands : A Hidden Object Adventure", ce jeu n'a rien à voir avec les autres jeux du même nom des mêmes développeurs de FiveBN (Dark Overlord, The Four Horsemen, The Golden Curse). Il ne repose pas sur le même principe de jeu d'aventure mêlant point&click et énigmes.


C'est l'histoire d'une ville elfe qui vit en paix depuis des siècles quand un jour le mal s'abat sur elle sous la forme de nuages noirs. Les habitants désertent et parcourent les océans à la recherche d'un nouveau lieu de vie mais ils traversent d'impitoyables tempêtes dont seuls quelques survivants en réchappent et échouent sur une île déserte. Ils ont avec eux un sarcophage qui, selon la légende, renferme l'Elu qui saura sauver son peuple de sa terrible destinée le temps venu. C'est alors qu'il se réveille...

C'est après cette introduction que commence le jeu et on se retrouve avec à l'écran une vue aérienne sur un village dans ce qui ressemble à première vue à un petit jeu de stratégie ou de gestion de ressources.
On a un capital de pièces d'or et de cristaux, des points d'XP, un niveau, une jauge d'énergie. On a également accès à un grand inventaire divisés en plusieurs catégories (potion d'énergie, coffres, amulettes, clés, outils, armes).


C'est le même jeu que "Lost Lands : A Hidden Object Adventure" mais les SOC sont simplement remplacées par du mahjong.

author: {'steamid': '76561198347682414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4041, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3591, 'last_played': 1505938314}
review:
La verdad es que es el primer Mahjong que he jugado, y la verdad, esperaba que fuera algo tranquilo y de relax. Sorpresa para mi es que está estructurado de tal forma que es bastante adictivo, pues su sistema de energia y recogida de objetos con zonas desbloqueadas te hace estar pendiente del juego.
En ocasiones el nivel es alto, pero nada que no se pueda sobrepasar con un poco de cabeza o estrategia.
Teniendo todo esto en cuenta, mi puntuación para este juego teniendo en cuenta que es gratis y la de horas que le puedes echar es de 10. Por no decir que a nivel de gráficos está muy elavorado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159366129', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 663, 'last_played': 1697301716}
review: Es un juego de mahjong, con una historia y misiones que son una simple excusa para jugar más partidas. Tiene dos problemas: el reparto de fichas es fijo (cada tablero tiene siempre las fichas en la misma disposición) y el uso de energía, que no te permite jugar el rato que quieras sinó que tienes que parar (o gastar dinero) para reponerla.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992856964', 'num_games_owned': 1022, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1501144429}
review:
The moment you first load the game, you're in an unskippable tutorial of the "You must click this part of the screen in order to progress to the next part" variety, in which all menus are disabled, so I hope the default volume and resolution work for you.

There's a lot of visually distracting chaff around the game, and writing that tries to draw you in but just ended up pushing me further away.  Kind of overwhelming for a casual game.  The gameplay itself seemed competent, and I'll come back to this one, but the aesthetics and first impression were a real negative for me.  Everything's so focused on being pretty that it's hard to tell what I can and can't click on, to the point where they literally have a button that zooms you over to the right section of the overmap and circles the part you're supposed to click on.  I guess someone in the playtesting phase had the same problem.

It really feels like they hired world of warcraft's concept artists to fully illustrate the game (and world of warcraft is absolutely stunning visually), but they neglected to get anyone familiar with interface design.  Kind of like when platformers don't make any visual distinction between objects that are in the foreground and the background -- you end up lost a lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198383631561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 446, 'last_played': 1516519742}
review: macht spaß nebenbei

author: {'steamid': '76561198062183175', 'num_games_owned': 481, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1501053128}
review:
If I recomend this thing, it's just because it's free and has mah jong in it, nothing else.

This game is like playing on your celphone or facebook, since it has an energy based system, and in game purchases, so, ever got trapped in a stage and no moves to go? gotta buy some diamonds to get the re-shuffle item, sure you can beat quests to get them, but you won't get as much diamonds as the items you are wasting, so, good luck.

The plot, you are a chosen one to banquish evil, you are suposed to be an ancient warrior who... 
wait, an ancient warrior who plays mah jong to.
no, no, no, just an ancient warrior.
Seriously? mah jong isn't even in the plot, you just play for beating quests, I see this chosen one fighting orcs shedding evil blood all over his face, ripping bodies appart, while inside his head he listens to the sounds of nature and soothing music as he enjoys an imaginary game of mah jong!

Dude, no!
The game was enjoyable, but get rid of the plot or make a serious effort to mix things up, even card games could do it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198292481339', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1500994955}

author: {'steamid': '76561198164033716', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1501344805}
review:
Salut,
Lost Land Mahjong est si vous n'aviez encore pas compris non pas un nouveau genre de jeu futuriste mais un simple mahjong classique incorporé dans un univers de fantaisie. Il est exactement comme tout les mahjong avec la difficulté réglable, de nombreux niveaux . Voila... c'est le jeu de brique chinois quoi.... Seulement on y a rajouté des missions ennuyeuses pour tuer des "monstres maléfiques" et dévérouiller des parties de la carte...

Bref voici l'évaluation :

Graphismes : 
☐ Des étoiles dans mes yeux !
☐ Très bons 
☑ Bons
☐ Acceptables
☐ Moches
☐ Aggression
C'est mahjong quoi le graphisme est net il n'y a pas de graphisme à proprement parlé parceque le jeu est à 90 % un écran fixe sauf quand vous trouvez une paire de brique donc bon.... C'est agréable coloré c'est déja sa.

Jouabilité : 
☑ easy magle !
☐ Jouable avec une bonne prise en main
☐ Difficilement jouable
☐ Injouable/ Affreux
Je ne vais pas faire de commentaire sa serait comme demander si c'est dure de jouer à solitaire...

Durée de vie :
☐ IMMORTELLE !
☐ Extrêmement longue
☑ Longue
☐ Bonne 
☐ Acceptable
☐ Trop courte
☐ Du vol.
A sa les dévelloppeur vous ont pas volés niveau quantité de level vous êtes servi vous en avez pour un bout de temps !

Bande son (bruitages + musiques) : 
☐ Un véritable concerto!
☐ Très bonne
☐ Bonne
☑ Classique
☐ Mauvaise
☐ Saignement oditif !
Le jeu se limite à une musique de fond zen si se n'est pas la musique de fantaisie du menu assez moyenne qui ressemble étrangement à celle d'un autre jeu en ligne qui n'a rien à voir mais bon ....

Scénario : 
☐ Waw !
☐ Très agréable et prenant
☐ Intéressant !
☑ Acceptable mais sans plus
☐ Mais où est le scénariste ?
Vous vous demandez pourquoi je parle de fantaisie sur Mahjong depuis tout à l'heure, voici les explications : Il y a une histoire sur le pourquoi vous faites du Mahjong parceque le mal à envahi les terres elfiques je crois et donc l'intégralité du jeu tourne autour de mission où vous faites un niveau, vous dropez l'objet recherché, vous avancez vous recommencez exetera... L'histoire n'est pas interressante du tout ! les missions sont d'une austérité pas possible.... pour seul but de déverrouillé par exemple la mine ... waw je suis tellement époustouflé  par le réalisme de ce jeu ....

Rapport qualité/prix :
☑ Gratuit 
☐ A ce prix là c'est donné !
☐ Bon prix
☐ Satisfaisant
☐ Discutable…
☐ Racket organisé !
Heuresement qu'il est gratuit parceque sa serait un peu de l'abu de le faire payer.. D'autant plus que si vous êtes comme moi c'est à dire quelqu'un qui commence à jouer et ne s'arrete que quand il en a mare vous allez être déçu de découvrir la politique de nombre de partie possible par jour, qui se recharge avec les temps....ya toujours moyen de payer sa ils ont mis plein d'offres même de quoi acheter les objets pour avancer... à croire qu'il y a des gens qui investissent réellement de l'argent pour avancer dans ce genre de jeu ...

Bref un mahjong plutôt simpliste quoi sauf qu'il est légèrement gaché par tout le tralala d'à côté et ce système de nombre de partie est simplement infecte et insuportable !

author: {'steamid': '76561198135620253', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 832, 'last_played': 1526655676}
review:
De graphics en de verhaallijn zijn erg mooi gemaakt. Ook het spelen van het spel Mahjong is geweldig. Het enige nadeel vind ik de ingame aankopen. Ik had liever een vaste prijs betaald voor het spel. Nu krijg je een beperkt aantal energiepunten waarmee je kan spelen. Wanneer je langer wil spelen, dan kost dit geld. Ook wanneer je vastloopt op bepaalde punten, dan wordt aangeraden om bepaalde items te kopen, welke ook weer geld kosten. 
Desondanks is het een mooi spel. Ik speel het casual en wanneer mijn energiepunten op zijn, switch ik gewoon over naar een ander spel.

review: If you like Mahjong, this is a good way to play it. Having quests, a story line and playing against the clock all make it that little bit more interesting. The music is excellent too, very relaxing. Having energy does mean you can't spend huge amounts of time playing before you have to take a break, but that's probably for the best. I, for one, could be there all day otherwise!

author: {'steamid': '76561198122163777', 'num_games_owned': 1846, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 505, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1685207303}
review:
This can become a pretty fun game if you are a patient sort of person.

This is a free game, so there is a pay system set up to help you play longer sessions and to aid you should you get stuck, but you never actually have to pay to fully enjoy the whole game. As long as you don't mind putting in only a half hour once or twice a day and then moving on to something else, this game is fairly satisfying.

The artwork is beautiful and the story is engaging, the mahjong boards vary enough, and there is a fair amount of choice as far as what to do on the map which makes for a surprising strategy element to the game. The chests have some fun little mini-games required to open them so that mahjong games are not the only puzzles you get to play.

It does take a few days or so to get the hang of how the game plays out, but as it is free to try, there is no reason not to give it a whirl and see if this title is for you. If you do find you like this game check out their Lost Lands: Hidden Objects and Mystic Saga (hidden object) games as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004672358', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1498958043}
review: как известно,бесплатный сыр только в мышеловке.вот и в этой игре тоже самое.она не такая уж и бесплатная как написано и это вобщем-то понятно почему - разработчики не поленились и старый добрый маджонг оформили в новом современном виде,с каким-никаким сюжетов про эльфов,уплывших от бедствий и потерпевших кораблекршение на каком-то острове,с очень красивой картинкой.игра конечно стоящая и любителям разбирать пирамидки маджонга очень понравится,но думаю,что им,как впрочем и остальным,уж очень не понравится ограничение по количеству ходов в игре:исследовать локации в поисках чего-либо для выполнения заданий стоит энергии,которая очень медленно пополняется и запас её истощается слишком быстро.это пожалуй самый большой минус этой игры - энергия на ходы.с донатом на различные подсказки,перемешку фишек и замедление времени в игре ещё можно смирится и пройти без всех этих "плюшек",но вот быстро заканчивающаяся энергия мало кому сейчас понравится,а хочешь восстановить её - плати деньги,и запросы в магазине чересчур велеки.вцелом поиграть конечно же можно,но с кончающейся энергией на этой уйдёт не больше пары часов в день,а потом жди восстановления.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065579746', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 610, 'last_played': 1526852330}
review:
Where's the neutral rating.... The game is fun. The saves getting moved and resetting your progress randomly is not. I did finially find a fix.
Go into User/AppDAta/Roaming/Five-BN Games/Mahjong/Steam
There should be a Save folder and another folder, the second folder had my original save data in it.
How do you recommend a buggy game that, when I looked for information on how to fix this, the devs aren't responding to any of the posts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198196521454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 47248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4160, 'last_played': 1536818481}
review:
If you ever thought to youself, "I wish mahjong and RPGs could have a baby," this is the game for you.

PROS: It's free, it's cute, it's not as boring as traditional mahjong.

CONS: You only have so much "energy" to expend, so if you like to play game after game after game, you'll get really frustrated waiting to recharge. Of course, you can "buy" energy (it's a free game, after all, they have to make money somehow).  So you can only play so much before you end up having to wait. Also, the graphics aren't good, and it can be hard to "see" the various matching mahjong tiles (they look very similar as well).

review:
Entretenido.
Pero no me gusta el sistema de "energía", ni que las pantallas sean por tiempo. Se supone que el mahjong es un juego para jugar precisamente SIN NINGUN APURO.
La dificultad de los cofres me parece bastante alta, mas aún teniendo en cuenta las recompensas que tampoco son tan importantes.
En fin... Se pasa el rato, lindos gráficos y poca cosa más.
